Job Description
Your Title: Database Developer
Job Location: Christchurch, Hybrid working options available
Position Overview:
The Business Systems Team at Trimble has created some modern and well-loved web applications that are critical to our global business. This team describes themselves as a collaborative and innovative Agile team and this role will enable further growth in terms of adding high-value features and supporting uptake by a wider audience. Underneath these applications reside a single cloud Amazon Relational Database Service with business logic encoded in stored procedures and related tables. This dataset is then related to a single global instance of Oracle Enterprise Business Suite with deeper business logic encoded in PL/SQL stored procedures and related tables. This role will be involved with both these technologies.
What you’ll do:
Consider potential work items from both a size and customer value perspective.
Contribute to collective decision making around the amount of work to undertake in a single work cycle.
Day to day see your contribution being integral to the overall team goals and support every team member.
Keep quality and progress for our stakeholder’s front of mind.
Be prepared to demonstrate and explain work completed to promote understanding. Also keep useful information updated on the team site.
Help the team improve processes by sharing and taking onboard topics discussed in retrospective.
What skills / qualifications / experience you’ll should bring:
Excellent SQL skills and knowledge of relational databases at a technical level.
Comfortable writing and debugging SQL and PL/SQL in large databases.
Understanding of transactional issues in online applications.
Comfortable working within an evolving development process.
Open to sharing, reviewing and having code reviewed to enhance code quality.
Some exposure of working with oracle database or oracle e-business suite.
Able to demonstrate working knowledge of mysql, Amazon hosting and git.
What skills / qualifications / experience you’ll could bring:
Understanding of operational issues in a global 24/7 enterprise.
Contributor to team goals and aligned with practicing agile methodology.
Experience with systems integration between COTS and green field applications.
Database design and ETL between databases.
Bachelors in Computing Science or similar would be advantageous but not essential if you possess relevant comparable experience.
What’s in it for you
Family Private Medical Cover
Employee Assistant / Occupational Counselling Programme (5 paid sessions for employee & family member)
Virgin Pulse Wellbeing Programme
On-site gym, showers, cycle parking
Life Insurance 3 x base salary & Permanent Disability Insurance
Access to our Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Trimble’s Social Club offering free/subsidized events
Bootcamp FItness Training at Lunchtimes
Yoga Classes at lunchtime (online)
Free onsite car parking
Annual leave 20 days + 12 public holidays per year
Trimble is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, colour, religion, national origin, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, or any other protected factor. Comfortable writing and debugging SQL and PL/SQL in large databases.
Understanding of transactional issues in online applications.
Comfortable working within an evolving development process.
Open to sharing, reviewing and having code reviewed to enhance code quality.
Some exposure of working with oracle database or oracle e-business suite.
Able to demonstrate working knowledge of mysql, Amazon hosting and git.
What skills / qualifications / experience you’ll could bring:
Understanding of operational issues in a global 24/7 enterprise.
Contributor to team goals and aligned with practicing agile methodology.
Experience with systems integration between COTS and green field applications.
Database design and ETL between databases.
Bachelors in Computing Science or similar would be advantageous but not essential if you possess relevant comparable experience.
What’s in it for you
Family Private Medical Cover
Employee Assistant / Occupational Counselling Programme (5 paid sessions for employee & family member)
Virgin Pulse Wellbeing Programme
On-site gym, showers, cycle parking
Life Insurance 3 x base salary & Permanent Disability Insurance
Access to our Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Trimble’s Social Club offering free/subsidized events
Bootcamp FItness Training at Lunchtimes
Yoga Classes at lunchtime (online)
Free onsite car parking
Annual leave 20 days + 12 public holidays per year

EOE/M/F/V/D Job Description
Your Title: Database Developer
Job Location: Christchurch, Hybrid working options available
Position Overview:
The Business Systems Team at Trimble has created some modern and well-loved web applications that are critical to our global business. This team describes themselves as a collaborative and innovative Agile team and this role will enable further growth in terms of adding high-value features and supporting uptake by a wider audience. Underneath these applications reside a single cloud Amazon Relational Database Service with business logic encoded in stored procedures and related tables. This dataset is then related to a single global instance of Oracle Enterprise Business Suite with deeper business logic encoded in PL/SQL stored procedures and related tables. This role will be involved with both these technologies.
What you’ll do:
Consider potential work items from both a size and customer value perspective.
Contribute to collective decision making around the amount of work to undertake in a single work cycle.
Day to day see your contribution being integral to the overall team goals and support every team member.
Keep quality and progress for our stakeholder’s front of mind.
Be prepared to demonstrate and explain work completed to promote understanding. Also keep useful information updated on the team site.
Help the team improve processes by sharing and taking onboard topics discussed in retrospective.
What skills / qualifications / experience you’ll should bring:
Excellent SQL skills and knowledge of relational databases at a technical level.
Comfortable writing and debugging SQL and PL/SQL in large databases.
Understanding of transactional issues in online applications.
Comfortable working within an evolving development process.
Open to sharing, reviewing and having code reviewed to enhance code quality.
Some exposure of working with oracle database or oracle e-business suite.
Able to demonstrate working knowledge of mysql, Amazon hosting and git.
What skills / qualifications / experience you’ll could bring:
Understanding of operational issues in a global 24/7 enterprise.
Contributor to team goals and aligned with practicing agile methodology.
Experience with systems integration between COTS and green field applications.
Database design and ETL between databases.
Bachelors in Computing Science or similar would be advantageous but not essential if you possess relevant comparable experience.
What’s in it for you
Family Private Medical Cover
Employee Assistant / Occupational Counselling Programme (5 paid sessions for employee & family member)
Virgin Pulse Wellbeing Programme
On-site gym, showers, cycle parking
Life Insurance 3 x base salary & Permanent Disability Insurance
Access to our Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Trimble’s Social Club offering free/subsidized events
Bootcamp FItness Training at Lunchtimes
Yoga Classes at lunchtime (online)
Free onsite car parking
Annual leave 20 days + 12 public holidays per year

Provide written and phone support to English speaking customers.
3+ Years hands-on IT/Technical Support experience, help-desk or desk-side support environment.
Must have knowledge in Microsoft Windows 10 and additionally one or more of the following: Mac OS X, Linux.
Strong verbal and written skills proven ability to communicate with technical and non-technical staff
Ability to work both independently and within a team environment
Display a commitment to quality and strong multi-tasking skills
Adherence to shift schedules and timeliness are key requirements
Willingness to work flexible shifts and scheduling, weekends, and holidays
Advanced Troubleshooting skills in a multi-user high pressure environment
Understanding of networking concepts such as DNS, DHCP, Email, HTTP, SSL, OSI
Model, and TCP/IP protocols and applications
Proven skills in PC repair, troubleshooting, deployment, and liquidation
Proven ability to work successfully with limited supervision
May require lifting or carrying desktop computers up to 25lbs
Some on call responsibilities are required
Some exposure with Linux or Unix

At Amazon, we strive to be Earth's most customer-centric company where people can find and discover anything they want to buy online. We hire the world's brightest minds, offering them an environment in which they can relentlessly improve the experience for customers. Amazon has an immediate opening for an IT Support Engineer in Wellington,NZ.


IT Support Engineers are Amazon’s front line when it comes to hands-on hardware and software troubleshooting. The position supports corporate employees in a variety of roles, from software developers to sales associates. Support Engineers provide hands-on support for client hardware and software on Windows, Mac, and Linux systems. They also support networking and local server resources for their site. They are the face of IT for their local customers; they serve as the liaison between site leadership and IT engineering teams. Regular activities include troubleshooting client operating systems, PC imaging and repair, network troubleshooting, project management, mentorship of junior technicians, systems administration, telecom administration, and hardware procurement.

Our IT Support Engineer also spend their day fielding incoming support chats, calls and online requests on behalf of Amazon Corporate and its subsidiary employees worldwide.



Support Engineers must have an excellent understanding of computers (both hardware and software) and a demonstrated willingness to learn and apply new technology. They must possess superior technical aptitude, written and oral communications skills, and the ability to deal effectively with people in a wide variety of situations. This position is part of a virtual team providing remote and in-person support to offices outside Amazon’s Seattle headquarters. Previous experience exercising high levels of initiative, judgment, and diplomacy with minimal supervision is required.

Provides comprehensive technical support to Amazon Corporate employees worldwide.
Research, resolve, and respond to inquiries received via web chat, telephone calls, email, ticketing system, all in a timely manner, in accordance with team standards.
Diagnose and troubleshoots end user computing problems including analyzing the problem, identification of appropriate resources, testing of proposed fixes and follow-up to ensure the problem has been resolved.
Creates and submits detailed call logs documenting customer interactions that are accurate, thorough, and timely.
Informs customer of needed repairs and answers basic questions. Ensures that customer understands and is satisfied with work completed.
Follow all standard operating procedures (SOP) through the effective use of Knowledge management.
Acquire and maintain current knowledge of relevant support policies in order to provide technically accurate solutions to users.
Assists with activities to triage and escalate any system or network outage to reduce downtime.

Bachelor's degree in Computer science or IT related field
Industry training such as Microsoft MCSE, MCITP
Experience with Cisco IOS (CLI) or Cisco certification
Advanced Linux systems administration skills / certification
Experience with scripting, programming, or SQL
Experience with project management
Experience with Data Cabling / Computer Facilities maintenance
Experience with server administration (Windows or Linux)
ITIL/ITSM

Full Stack Software Engineer Admin Experience Coviu Global Pty LtdAbout UsCoviu is a catalyst for life-changing online care anywhere. An Australian start-up, Coviu’s software is a beautifully designed, intuitive, and engaging cloud-native video consultation platform purpose-built for healthcare.At Coviu we enable healthcare providers including doctors and allied health professionals to deliver higher quality, more engaging care. Coviu integrates seamlessly with standardised assessments and clinical tools to make it simple to deliver higher quality care to their clients.Coviu’s unique web-based software and clinical tools meet the highest data encryption standards, making us the Australian Government’s provider of choice for video telehealth.We are deeply committed to innovation, research validation, privacy and security, simplicity of use, scalability and interoperability with existing systems. Our Coviu team are a friendly, close-knit group of like-minded people who are excited about changing the healthcare landscape.We are looking for an energetic Full Stack Software Engineer to join our Admin Experience squad who are building and managing our customer facing admin dashboard that is a key differentiator of our telehealth platform. You will be working with a large variety of cutting edge technologies and pushing the limits of the browser to deliver the future of Telehealth.The RoleAs a Full Stack Engineer your responsibilities will include:Write clean, easily maintainable code to meet system requirements, system designs and technical specifications in accordance with quality accredited standardsWriting, updating and maintaining technical program, end user documentation and operational proceduresImprove the architecture of our platform, to enable increasing levels of self-serviceWorking across most of our platform components, including our WebRTC based video conferencing solution, third party integrations, and our internal and external applicationAbout the TeamOur Admin Experience Squad looks after administrative workflows and organization administration within Coviu Systems, including user profiles, user settings, data collections, booking and scheduled sessions, billing & plan, waiting area, enterprise interface and admin tools.Why work at Coviu?Here at Coviu, we strive hard to work towards a better future for healthcare, providing the tools to enable care, from anywhere. To achieve this, we’re committed to building an inclusive and diverse workplace of people.When you join Coviu you can expect:A company committed to open communication and retaining outstanding talent.A dynamic team that enjoy taking on new challenges, solving problems and ensuring the best possible customer experience.A safe and flexible workplace as a remote-first business with optional office hours in either our Sydney or Brisbane office.Flexible ways of working, we at Coviu want to empower our team to feel trusted and respected every day.A generous work from home allowance to set up a home office to enable remote work.An opportunity to make a significant impact in the digital transformation of the healthcare industry.We have a passionate and friendly team who are leaders in At AKQA, we believe in the imaginative application of art and science to create beautiful ideas, products and services. With an entrepreneurial and collaborative approach, we design adaptive digital services and applications that capture the imagination, delivering impressive returns for our clients.

As a Senior .NET Developer with extensive Sitecore experience, you will develop and deliver high-quality digital platforms based on the .NET/Microsoft umbrella of technologies. Motivated by work that is ground-breaking in its thinking and execution, you will build technology solutions that enable our world-class clients to succeed.

Located in Auckland, as part of AKQA, you will work in a meritocratic culture, surrounded by some of the brightest minds in their fields. You will have the opportunity to learn and grow within a creative and technically advanced team, and have access to ongoing personal and professional development. At AKQA, we are committed to your career growth, as well as to your work/life balance.

ROLE REQUIREMENTS

Expertise in software engineering including ASP.NET/MVC and C#.
Deep understanding of the web: protocols, architecture, infrastructure, servers (IIS), proxies, load balancing, high availability and databases, etc.
Deep understanding of modern patterns and practices: unit testing, inversion of control, repository, MVC and continuous integration, etc.

QUALITIES AND CHARACTERISTICS

Excellent dev-ops skills and experience, enabling you to develop market-leading solutions.
Entrepreneurial, analytic and positive mindset with a personable and professional approach.
Sharp attention to detail and a passion for new technology.

AKQA is an Equal Opportunities Employer, we believe that diversity is vital to AKQA's ability to provide our clients with the best recommendations and are committed to fostering a varied and inclusive work environment. Your race, colour, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability or veteran status have no bearing on our hiring decisions. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know. Excellent dev-ops skills and experience, enabling you to develop market-leading solutions.
Entrepreneurial, analytic and positive mindset with a personable and professional approach.
Sharp attention to detail and a passion for new technology.

Digital Channel Developer
We have an exciting opportunity for someone to join ASB's Digital Production chapter within our Brand & Marketing practice.

Build direct communications to customers via ASB's owned digital channels
North Wharf location, plenty of career scope for advancement, great banking & employee benefits

Our Brand & Marketing team highlight what makes ASB so special, different, and innovative to our customers. If you're passionate about Digital and love building world class, personalised omni-channel digital marketing - we are looking for you. Working within Digital Production you'll be part of the marketing automation squad to produce conversations to customers through a suite of inbound and outbound digital channels.

The role

This role work within the marketing automation squad (alongside direct marketing and marketing data analysts) to collaboratively design and deliver direct communications to customers via our owned digital channels primarily via the website, eDM, SMS Programs and Authenticated channels.

You will provide specialist digital content and system management to the Digital Marketing and the wider marketing teams.

In this role you will be responsible for:

Working closely with our Data & Analytics and Marketing team to produce succinct marketing automation conversations.
Use Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) to build, test and deploy channel specific messages
Confident HTML ability to build, test, and deploy emails using Watson Campaign Automation.
Create and maintain ongoing, automated campaign programmes
Create SMS programs
Comfortable editing basic XML
Pull reports and insights
Build, test and maintain web forms

What we are looking for

You will bring agency or tribe experience and thrive in a dynamic, energised environment. This ideal candidate will be driven, enthusiastic and have confidence to represent digital marketing best practice within the squad.

You will be building content across multiple channels using various tools and you will work closely with the digital marketing team to ensure that all digital channels and customer touch points remain consistent and on-brand.

Technical skills including:

Hand coding XHTML/HTML5, CSS, Basic JavaScript/jQuery
Applications experience - CMS authoring and publishing (AEM preferred) and a good knowledge of email platforms (Watson Campaign Automation preferred))
The ability to translate technically complex scenarios in a simple, direct way
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Eye for detail / proofreading
Ability to work independently, manage multiple stakeholders, exercise patience and prioritise workload to changing need

Why ASB is a great place to work

At ASB, we are committed to our vision and values of Integrity, Caring, Passion, Courage and United. Our strength comes from caring about our people, our customers, our community and environment.

As a values driven organisation we are committed to providing a flexible and supportive work environment, where we bring our different perspectives and strengths to achieve ASB goals together. We offer excellent career progression opportunities, a diverse and inclusive work culture; we help our people grow and celebrate together.

Job Requirements -
The Oracle services division of Duco Consultancy is a supplier of finance, procurement, supply chain, retail, integration advisory and consulting services to clients across Oracle, Microsoft, SAP and other ERP applications. Our advisors combine extensive knowledge of integration to provide clients with a service which adds recognized value. Consulting is an exciting and challenging environment which enables our global specialists to offer process consulting, management consulting, risk consulting and transactions and restructuring services to our clients.

Assignments are often managed on a multi-disciplinary basis utilising the skills and experience of advisors from diverse industry knowledge and skill sets. There is an expectation that individuals can work outside their service area and across the wider Advisory business should the need arise to benefit clients and to gain skills for our staff.
Purpose of position:

 Develop integrations using Oracle products like Oracle Integration Cloud and Oracle SOA Suite, plus related IaaS and PaaS components

 Create & maintain appropriate technical documentation to assist in various stages of software development including architecture and detailed design documents

Apply technical skills to provide solutions to business problems achieving business objectives, meeting functional and non-functional requirements

Evaluate requirements and technical limitations with clients

Liaise with technical architects & other project or team members to ensure technical standards are met

Participate in knowledge transfer sessions and required training sessions.
Experience Needed to Perform the Job

2-5 years + experience in Integration technologies

Experience with integration to / from Oracle SaaS Cloud solutions including ERP, HCM and EPM, plus older applications like EBS 11.5.x & R12

Experience of designing integrations for cloud, on-premise and hybrid solutions

Hands on experience with IaaS / PaaS components including Oracle database, VMs, SFTP servers and similar

Experience of using integration patterns including RESTful and SOAP web service APIs plus real time / batch processing.

Experience on middleware technologies SOA, ESB, BPEL, BAM, and messaging queue
Formal Education & Certification

Bachelor’s Degree in Software Engineering, Commerce, Information Systems, Information Management, Computer Science or any other related subjects.

Oracle Cloud certifications


Additionally, you will bring:
Excellent written and technical writing skills.

Good communication, positive attitude and team player

Highly self-motivated and able to work with minimal supervision.

Ability to conduct research into emerging technologies and how to apply them to create real world solutions.

Keen attention to detail.

Delivers exceptional client service Job Requirements -

About us
Isobar is a global digital agency of 6,500 people across 45 markets, united by our vision to transform businesses, brands and people's lives with the creative use of digital.

We deliver experience-led transformation, solving complex business challenges through our digital marketing & communications, ecosystems & commerce, products & services and transformation consulting offering.

In the past two years, Isobar has been awarded over 450 times, including the Digital Craft Grand Prix at Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity in 2018, as well as multiple Clio, Webby, and Effie Awards. Research firm Forrester also named Isobar a Leader in Commerce in its Q4 2018 ""Forrester Wave"" report.
We are now looking for a Senior Front End Developer to join the growing team in our Auckland office.


What are my responsibilities?
Create modular components that can be used within either Silverstripe, Sitecore or AEM
Hand-code web and mobile applications
Design front-end applications and collaborate with designers to build interactive web experiences
Write well-formed, unobtrusive Javascript with scalability and extensibility in mind
Design front-end architecture that integrates with other systems and technologies
Clearly and effectively communicate front-end application architecture. Help translate technical solutions and development jargon into plain English for both clients and the internal team.
Write standards-compliant XHTML & CSS with thought given to accessibility and SEO
Optimize front-end application performance
Assist with the development of workflows and processes

What qualities do I need to be successful?
Communicates clearly and proactively across relevant team members during production to ensure the production of high-quality solutions, on time and on budget.
Manages to compete for workload demands to achieve agreed deadlines without sacrificing the quality of work.
Shows commitment to their craft through the pursuit of high-quality standards and a strong dedication to output world-class solutions.
Explore new ideas, techniques, and creative solutions without compromising the quality of work.
Proactively identifies potential problems early in the project lifecycle and takes responsibility for developing realistic solutions with a positive approach.
Forms effective working relationships internally, to improve collaboration and achieve an optimal output.
Displays an ongoing commitment and desire to develop the necessary skills, knowledge and experience required to effectively contribute to the agency’s excellence.
Displays enthusiasm and commitment towards the agency injects energy into their role and affects the company culture in a positive manner. Actively pursues results in the best interest of the business.
Understands commercial considerations across all elements of the business, takes a commercial approach to client and internal work.

How to apply
If you meet the above criteria and are interested in joining our growing team, click below to apply.

We are now looking for a Senior Front End Developer to join the growing team in our Auckland office. Show more

Our purpose
Here at Datacom, we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.
Our team
The Experience Platforms team is part of our Application Services group. We provide high value custom web solutions and consulting services to leading Australasian businesses and government agencies.
Our mission is to deliver the best business value, without compromising quality, by engaging closely with our clients and fully understanding their requirements. With specialists in analysis, architecture, development, testing and project management we are able to design and build leading Digital solutions for any business challenge or opportunity.
About us
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in everything Digital including web and mobile development, operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.
About the Role
You’ll find a refreshing variety of work here; we do everything from boutique websites, through to large Digital Experience Platforms. We have teams who specialise in every area of tech, so you can learn from the best. You’ll also find that you are involved in the full SDLC, from presales and RFP stage through to delivery.
We’re a far cry from the daily grind of a typical dev shop, with internal team challenges such as our internal Datacomp innovation competition, hosted and judged by our CEO, through to dev camp retreats, and career boot camps. We attract and retain talented, passionate developers who are creative and love what they do.
What you'll bring
With 5+ years development experience, you will be confident developing with multiple front end and back end technologies like Java, PHP, JavaScript, CSS, HTML, SASS, JQuery, React, and MySQL with experience in CMS platforms development. You have passion for technology and an unrelenting desire to deliver on projects.
With our team you’ll thrive in the work hard, play hard environment and you’ll be pushed to challenge yourself producing applications and systems that help some of NZ’s most high-profile businesses stay competitive and ahead of the game. With our scale you’ll be able to move across teams and work on new and interesting work as we continue to grow. You’ll also work alongside highly capable and experienced team members on challenging projects. With the size of Datacom and the amount of work we do there are plenty of opportunities and support to grow your career with us. If you are looking for your next challenge, then apply now!

Requirements:
Requirements

5+ years commercial or digital agency experience
Experienced Web Developer with experience in CMS platforms, HTML, CSS, HTML, SASS, JavaScript, TypeScript, JQuery, JSON and MySQL, React, NodeJs, Java and PHP
Solid understanding of OOP concepts
Excellent debugging and troubleshooting skills
Experience working with version control systems such as Git
API integration experience

Desired skills:

Knowledge of CMS platforms like and a desire to work with a range of platforms such as Adobe, Sitecore, Kentico, Contenful, Drupal, Silverstripe WordPress, etc.
Google Analytics
Experience working with Scrum/Agile development

Professional Qualities:

Attention to detail
Deadline driven
Excellent communication skills
Work well within a team environment
Proficient in English

Benefits:
Benefits

4 weeks holiday per year
Non-contributory medical (Regular Care)
Life Insurance
Income Protection Insurance
Hybrid working

With our team you’ll thrive in the work hard, play hard environment and you’ll be pushed to challenge yourself producing applications and systems that help some of NZ’s most high-profile businesses stay competitive and ahead of the game. With our scale you’ll be able to move across teams and work on new and interesting work as we continue to grow. You’ll also work alongside highly capable and experienced team members on challenging projects. With the size of Datacom and the amount of work we do there are plenty of opportunities and support to grow your career with us. If you are looking for your next challenge, then apply now!

Requirements:
Requirements

5+ years commercial or digital agency experience
Experienced Web Developer with experience in CMS platforms, HTML, CSS, HTML, SASS, JavaScript, TypeScript, JQuery, JSON and MySQL, React, NodeJs, Java and PHP
Solid understanding of OOP concepts
Excellent debugging and troubleshooting skills
Experience working with version control systems such as Git
API integration experience

Desired skills:

Knowledge of CMS platforms like and a desire to work with a range of platforms such as Adobe, Sitecore, Kentico, Contenful, Drupal, Silverstripe WordPress, etc.
Google Analytics
Experience working with Scrum/Agile development

Professional Qualities:

Attention to detail
Deadline driven
Excellent communication skills
Work well within a team environment
Proficient in English

Benefits:
Benefits

4 weeks holiday per year
Non-contributory medical (Regular Care)
Life Insurance
Income Protection Insurance
Hybrid working

Kami is an award-winning startup based in Auckland, New Zealand. Our leading digital classroom app offers meaningful solutions to over 30 million users worldwide, helping educators create a more interactive and collaborative learning experience for the students.

You’ll join at a pretty magical time. Kami’s user base is growing and thriving. With over 70 team members based across Auckland, the USA, South Africa and Brazil we’re really proud of all the accomplishments and milestones we’ve achieved, so far. This is a chance to join our team and become an integral member of Kami’s growth.
We are looking for talented developers who love to create amazing web experiences to join NZ’s fastest-growing company. We are helping over 30 million teachers and students eliminate printing and scanning and the associated costs and effort - so teachers can spend more of their time on achieving better learning outcomes for the next generation.

As an engineer for this forward-thinking startup, you will not be locked in the backroom implementing specs sheets - you’ll be talking to the customers/teachers who already love their product, and figuring out how to make it work even better for them. This position will suit an Engineer with a good product sense and is comfortable working relatively autonomously but who can also collaborate well both internally and externally.

With the majority of users based in the US, we travel to attend conferences, trade shows and to visit schools using our software. So ideally you will relish the opportunity to travel and have no passport restrictions.
Qualifications

Technical skills and experience required for the role are:

Proficiency with Javascript, HTML, CSS, and experience working with large Single Page Applications (SPAs). Experience with frontend frameworks/libraries, e.g AngularJS, VueJS, React.
Strong product sense and ability to work with customers to design bespoke solutions.
Experience with developing high-performance front-end code, profiling with Chrome Developer tools.
Appetite to learn new languages and technologies.
They adopt the latest tech fast, including Service Workers, Native Client, and real-time communication in our app (Most of their users are on evergreen browsers, so we get to use the new web technologies).
This is primarily a front-end engineering position, however, they use Ruby, Rails, Java, Kubernetes (with GKE).
PostgreSQL and CockroachDB in the backend and experience with them is a bonus.
Great communication and engagement skills.
A positive, passionate and collaborative approach.

Technologies we use: (Nice to Have)

TypeScript
Rust


Additional information

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

The opportunity to work for a great employer that genuinely makes a difference around the world.
Excellent work perks
Flexible working
A diverse and challenging role
Learning and development opportunities
The opportunity to grow and scale a unique company

Kami is an equal opportunity workplace, and we would like to hear from all qualified applicants. If you have a disability or any special needs that we might need to accommodate, please let us know.
Remote work a possibility for the right candidate.

Full Stack Developer

NZ's fairest telco is on the lookout for talented developers (Intermediate & Senior), who can bring new and innovative ideas and tackle challenges across the full-stack.

Here's what you'll do in this job:

Design and develop the delivery of high-volume, high-performance, high-availability applications/libraries/APIs using proven frameworks and technologies
Assist other developers, analysts and designers in conceptualising and developing new software programs and applications
Mentor others on the team to help grow their technical capabilities
Work closely with other engineering teams to gain bottom-up consensus in delivering technology solutions
Liaise with the delivery manager and technical architect to explore and suggest appropriate technical solutions to achieve the required features while safeguarding functionality, scalability and performance.
Support the DevOps culture, continuously improve our implementation of DevOps

……And here's some of the different things you might also do:

Hero your lifestyle with a mix of working from home and in the office.
Develop your skills for future roles with leadership and specialist learning pathways.
Join a culture dedicated to making New Zealand a better place to live and work - rare in the telco market.

Show us your different sides too:

Experience with building REST APIs using .Net core Web API
Front-end development skills using JavaScript frameworks such as Vue or Angular
Experience with relational databases and ORMs such as EF or NHibernate
Strong understanding of DevOps and deploying software using CI/CD tools
Experience with agile working methodologies

Experience with cloud platforms such as Azure and AWS would be helpful, and in addition, you will be passionate about technology with an eagerness to contribute in a team-oriented environment. Along with this you will be an excellent multitasker, who is able to balance multiple priorities while communicating effectively at all levels within the business.

This role will provide end to end exposure with writing code through to deployment, different ways of working, DevOps aligned and value stream model, variety through shifting between value streams based on strengths/interests and exposure to cutting edge technology!

Sound fair? Let's chat.

2degrees. It's time for something different.

Job Description
We Believe in Better!
We are a global information technology company that builds high-performance, security-centric solutions that can help change the world. Enhancing people’s lives through secure, reliable advanced technology is our vision.
At Unisys, we believe in better! Here, you have the opportunity to learn new skills, apply your expertise, and solve complex problems with cutting edge technologies and solutions. You are part of a global diverse team that supports you, drives change, and delivers successful results consistently.
Our associates are at the forefront of everything we do, driving our clients’ successes while giving back to communities and making this world a safer and more secure place to live and work. Our success is a direct result of the work of our people who live and breathe our Core Beliefs. Simply put, we believe in better lives. Join us!
Learn more about Unisys and our key solution offerings: Unisys, Stealth™, CloudForte®, InteliServe™
What success looks like in this role:
As our API Developer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining web-based custom applications for the organization, providing technical support for developed applications.
You will deliver value by:
API/back end/front end code in one or more languages.
Understanding, creating, manipulating and querying databases.
Working with systems infrastructure – hardware, OS, preparing the system and dependencies for all software.
#LI-LR1
You will be successful in this role if you have:
Development - C#, ASP.NET MVC, WebAPI, WCF, EntityFramework, NUnit, xUnit, JSON, XML
Databases - SQL Server 2016/2014
API Documentation – Swagger
Experience working with and developing for Mulesoft Anypoint Platform (ideally Anypoint Studio 7 and Mule 4)
Experience of building apps in cloud environments, preferably Microsoft Azure will be highly advantageous
Authentication - Active Directory, Azure Active Directory, Windows Identity Foundation, STS
Source Control - Git, Team Foundation Version Control
Minimum of 3 years IT experience and knowledge of .NET framework
Minimum of 3 years of experience in object-oriented analysis and design of business solutions
A working knowledge of microservices architecture is a significant plus.
Good working knowledge and experience in SDLC processes and tools including agile methodologies.
Strong oral and written English skills.
Please click on the "Apply Now" button below to submit your application.
Unisys is an equal opportunity employer and fosters an inclusive culture that embraces differences and diversity. We welcome applications from all sections of society.

Do you want to work on projects where you’re actually trusted and empowered to make meaningful change for some of Australasia’s leading companies?Dream of working in a place you can call home rather than have to change your career every two years to get ahead?Want to be part of a team that focuses on getting the job done and having a good time while doing it?If you answered yes to any of the above...then we should talk!We’re Sandfield and we build smart software solutions for some of Australasia’s top brands.We’re working on some pretty cool projects right now and there’s plenty more in our (very long) pipeline...so we need more talented Software Developers to join our awesome team.*About Sandfield*We’re a leading, Kiwi-owned, software business that prides itself on NOT just being a conventional tech company.We've been backing ourselves, and our ability to create great solutions for clients, since we first opened our doors in 1989. Since then, we’ve developed some pretty innovative systems for clients which leave other, more high-profile, software packages in the dust.Our work facilitates high performance supply chains for the likes of Mainfreight, Qube and Allied Concrete and keeps millions of orders and data points flowing for Foodstuffs. It also manages business finances for Toll and Green Acres, helps fill seats on the Interislander for KiwiRail and keeps Les Mills members engaged...plus so much more.One thing we think speaks for itself is that we’ve never had a sales team - our work and success story has been predominantly built on our reputation and referrals alone.*Our pitch to you*We know it’s a competitive market out there and loads of other companies are also probably trying to ‘woo’ you right now with big numbers and equally big promises.What we can offer is something a little more special.Our developers get to deal directly with our clients and we spend just as much time nurturing soft skills, such as communication and business acumen, as we do helping our developers be even more ‘ninja’ at their coding.We guarantee your ‘everyday’ will be interesting, varied, challenging and fun! You’ll get to work with a range of other smart developers of all levels, who also happen to be really great people too.They’re mountain bikers, road bikers, skiers, runners, active relaxers, video gamers, animal lovers, movie buffs, gym buffs, foodies, wine critics, bakers and musicians. They’re also family people, single people, party people, quiet people, loud people and happy people.Our collaborative culture is at the centre of everything we do at Sandfield and it makes it a pretty special place to work. We know this because people also don’t tend to leave - i.e. the average length of service here is at least five years.We also have a beer fridge, funky offices and ‘fun food Fridays’!But don’t just take our word for it - here’s what our people say about working at Sandfield (Working at Sandfield).As an organisation, we’re also very conscious of our environmental footprint and are currently on a journey to become carbon neutral in the very near future.*Our tech stack*We work across a variety of technologies, although specialise in a Microsoft stack, and always select the right technology based on our client’s needs. We’re primarily building web-based applications but have opportunities for mobile development as well.We love to work across the full stack - but we know that is a lot to learn so don’t worry if you don’t have full stack experience, we have plenty of experienced devs to learn from and support you as you go.You’ll need:Experience building web application using.NET - WebAPI, MVC or WebFormsHTML, CSS and JavaScript.Microsoft SQL ServerRemember - even if you don’t have experience across the full stack we’d still love to have a chat to youBonus points for experience with React or React NativeAn interest in all aspects of the SDLC including talking to clientsWhen you work for us, you’ll enjoy: Rapid career advancement based on initiative and performanceA huge variety of workA relaxed, supportive and social environmentAn opportunity to work alongside some highly experienced developersThe freedom to employ creative thinking and really make a difference to our clients’ businessesBeing involved in everything from conceptual design to the full SDLCA flat team structure that emanates lots of positive energy!Flexible working policySoft skills trainingRegular social events and ‘Fun Food Fridays’A well stocked beer fridge (including non-alcoholic!) and fruit bowl1Password for Families free of chargeFree flu shotsMake your next move with us!If you’re happy with just being a number at a big brand tech company so your Mum can brag at Bridge Club...we’re probably not for you.But if you want to join a great team and be part of the driving force behind some innovative tech solutions for a range of top companies in this part of the world, then let’s talk!Even if you’re comfortable in your current role, but want to explore future opportunities, it could still be worthwhile having a chat with us.You can check out more about Sandfield and what it’s like working for us hereThe salary is dependant on skills and experience. The range for an intermediate Software Developer is $100k to $130k.Standard working hours are 40 hours per week.Job Type: Full-time Do you want to work on projects where you’re actually trusted and empowered to make meaningful change for some of Australasia’s leading companies?Dream of working in a place you can call home rather than have to change your career every two years to get ahead?Want to be part of a team that focuses on getting the job done and having a good time while doing it?If you answered yes to any of the above...then we should talk!We’re Sandfield and we build smart software solutions for some of Australasia’s top brands.We’re working on some pretty cool projects right now and there’s plenty more in our (very long) pipeline...so we need more talented Software Developers to join our awesome team.*About Sandfield*We’re a leading, Kiwi-owned, software business that prides itself on NOT just being a conventional tech company.We've been backing ourselves, and our ability to create great solutions for clients, since we first opened our doors in 1989. Since then, we’ve developed some pretty innovative systems for clients which leave other, more high-profile, software packages in the dust.Our work facilitates high performance supply chains for the likes of Mainfreight, Qube and Allied Concrete and keeps millions of orders and data points flowing for Foodstuffs. It also manages business finances for Toll and Green Acres, helps fill seats on the Interislander for KiwiRail and keeps Les Mills members engaged...plus so much more.One thing we think speaks for itself is that we’ve never had a sales team - our work and success story has been predominantly built on our reputation and referrals alone.*Our pitch to you*We know it’s a competitive market out there and loads of other companies are also probably trying to ‘woo’ you right now with big numbers and equally big promises.What we can offer is something a little more special.Our developers get to deal directly with our clients and we spend just as much time nurturing soft skills, such as communication and business acumen, as we do helping our developers be even more ‘ninja’ at their coding.We guarantee your ‘everyday’ will be interesting, varied, challenging and fun! You’ll get to work with a range of other smart developers of all levels, who also happen to be really great people too.They’re mountain bikers, road bikers, skiers, runners, active relaxers, video gamers, animal lovers, movie buffs, gym buffs, foodies, wine critics, bakers and musicians. Unleashed Software (that’s us) are a cloud-based solution at the heart of great businesses that make, manage and move products - and we've had a busy couple of years. We hit double digits, celebrating 10 years in business, were fortunate enough to pick up some fabulous accolades (winning the Westpac Business Awards 'Employer of the Year','Supreme Business Excellence' in 2019 and be the recipient of the Xero Small Business App of the Year), set up a new team and office in Melbourne, and we became one of the newest members of the Access Group (in APAC) in November 2020. Plus lots of really really important BAU work got done - all whilst navigating that very annoying C-word (yep - Covid).
Our global team (made up of Engineering, Product, Customer Engagement, Sales, Marketing & Operations) has grown to over 120 employees (and a dog or two) and we’re now looking for highly skilled individuals who are excellent collaborators with fantastic implementation skills. We’re always evolving and updating our technology and the passion to pick-up new technologies is paramount.
To give you a bit of background.... in our earlier days, our SaaS product was a feature-rich, customer-focused ASP.NET web application built iteratively over a number of years. The original version of our product was built on a private cloud host, and we only deployed updates a few times per-year (manually, by the way!). In the last few years, we have been hard at work, embracing automation & agile practices, and transforming our architecture into a modern component-based web app & service stack using the latest AWS cloud technologies, whilst always keeping our customers at the forefront of our mind - continually growing, enhancing and improving the product. We now test and deploy automatically, and release updates to our customers at least twice a week. As we continue our evolution, we want to release product updates multiple times per day and become 100% AWS native (which includes moving to a scalable microservices architecture).
To give you a glimpse of how we are doing things currently, our latest projects use .NET Core, React, and Angular - with Microservice and Serverless application architectures. We are currently a significant user of AWS technologies and we expect that to continue growing.APIs are obviously really important to us for our core systems’ architecture as well as our direct integrations with other high profile SaaS Companies (Xero, Shopify, Amazon, Vend, etc). We collaborate using Agile methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban, but we prefer to let each of our teams decide what suits them best. We always encourage open communication across all functional areas and reporting lines.
You will be part of a small, cross-functional and self-organising team focused on quality, working on a suite of web applications, and implementing cutting-edge web technologies. You will be expected to interpret requirements, design, develop, validate and release your work within our adaptive agile culture - incorporating scrum, Kanban, TDD and XP – using the right methodology to achieve and maintain the result required. You are encouraged to grow technical skills & product knowledge and we ask that you learn and take manageable risks, expect and interpret feedback on your performance and have an open mind for personal training and development opportunities as they arise.
We know this isn't your conventional detailed job advert, but really we wanted to just paint a picture of who we are, where we're going and to see if you're interested in joining us on this awesome journey. Recruitment in the current climate is certainly a bit different, however, we're working hard to make sure we can give you a great understanding of what life at Unleashed is like and to induct and onboard you to be successful.


Here at Unleashed we also believe there is great value in having a workforce that represents the customers we interact with on a daily basis, which is why we embrace an approach that respects, values and celebrates the unique attributes, characteristics, and perspectives that make each person who they are and ask people to bring their true authentic selves to work each day.
For the full position description for the role (which has all the detail, so you'll want to read it), please look here and if you have any other questions, feel free to email us at: joinourjourney@unleashedsoftware.com. Otherwise, if you already know this is the role for you, please apply directly via our internal careers portal via : https://www.unleashedsoftware.com/careers Unleashed Software (that’s us) are a cloud-based solution at the heart of great businesses that make, manage and move products - and we've had a busy couple of years. job_title: Mulesoft Developer - Permanent or Hourly Rate Contract
listing_jobDesc:
Join an award-winning consulting practice with global reach and thought-leadership.Be part of a high-performing team and expand your experience and capabilities.We support flexible working and believe it is critical to increasing engagement, optimising resources, supporting work-life balance and employee wellbeing.
About the Platform and Cloud Engineering
Deloitte "PACE" (Platform and Cloud Engineering) is changing how businesses leverage cloud-native technology to solve the toughest technology challenges our customers face! Our PACE team are thought leaders and specialists in API, Cloud and Container technologies. We accelerate digital transformation by unlocking the value of core systems at the heart of organisations to the many and varied digital channels required by modern applications. We work with our customers to create modern technology solutions that can be transparently run and managed in the cloud or by hybrid architectures.
Our Team
Come and join us if you are excited about the future of technology and want to build a future-proof career while working within a collaborative and supportive culture for an organisation that will invest in you.
Our team are united in their pursuit of technical excellence, passion for delivery, and aspirations to improve continuously. We are willing to think and work differently and ultimately thrive on winning as a Champion Team. Our team is lean, flat and skews heavily towards practitioners; we embrace Quality as a key differentiator in how we deliver solutions to our clients.
We are a local NZ team of 50+ engineers, and we combine this with 800+ PACE Engineers in Australia and many more spread throughout the world. Deloitte is an amazing global network where you can find an expert in anything, and learn from the best.
In addition to joining a fantastic team, you will receive an industry-leading remuneration package with benefits, like flexi-time, an award-winning parental leave package, a suite of learning and development opportunities (technical certifications, leadership and personal development), access to the global Deloitte tech community and unparalleled opportunities to engage with leading software vendors such as AWS, Microsoft, Salesforce, MuleSoft, and Red Hat.
As our team continues to grow and develop, we are now looking for Integration Developers with an API, Microservices, and Integration focus who are eager to challenge their technical and consulting skills with us!
To be successful in this role, you will need to demonstrate the following:
Experience working on MuleSoft Integration Platform; or demonstrable experience working in a similar platform combined with a strong drive to learn MuleSoft.
Development, testing and production support of API integrations using Mulesoft;
Proven track record in supporting or developing on Cloud Native platforms (Red Hat Operating System, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure Cloud and Docker is highly regarded);
Experience and interest in solving the "hard" integration problems between enterprise systems. Knowing how to approach integration problems using API design patterns, messaging & pub/sub. Know how to build integration solutions that are robust and testable through the SDLC using integration testing, logging, tracing etc.
Passion for CICD practices using tools such as Github, Jenkins, Bitbucket and Azure DevOps;
Experience with Groovy scripting and Java frameworks - Spring is an added advantage;
Experience with logging and metrics technologies including Elasticsearch, Fluentd, Kibana, and Prometheus
Desire to collaborate, innovate, build reusable IP, learn and mentor through practice-wide coding dojos, brown-bags, hackathons etc.
Next Steps
If you have the drive and passion to succeed, apply now.
From 11 April 2022 it is no longer a condition of our COVID Response policy that our people, clients, contractors and visitors be vaccinated to attend our premises, Deloitte events or client premises (except where a client has a vaccine pass mandate in place). However, given the changing nature of the pandemic, we do reserve the right, following a Health & Safety Risk Assessment, to require that a role be performed by a person vaccinated against COVID-19 to minimise the health and safety risk to our people therefore ongoing collection of vaccination status will be important for managing future risks.
Deloitte is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.
We understand there have been cases of phishing emails purporting to be recruiters for Deloitte. Any communication from Deloitte New Zealand regarding an employment application will come from a “@deloitte.co.nz” or from our Applicant Tracking System “@hire.lever.co” email address or our video interview platform deloittenz.hirevue.com. If you have received a suspicious email and would like to verify validity of any communications that appear to be from Deloitte New Zealand, please contact us on NZinfo@deloitte.co.nz Join an award-winning consulting practice with global reach and thought-leadership.Be part of a high-performing team and expand your experience and capabilities.We support flexible working and believe it is critical to increasing engagement, optimising resources, supporting work-life balance and employee wellbeing.

If you have received a suspicious email and would like to verify validity of any communications that appear to be from Deloitte New Zealand, please contact us on NZinfo@deloitte.co.nz Join an award-winning consulting practice with global reach and thought-leadership.Be part of a high-performing team and expand your experience and capabilities.We support flexible working and believe it is critical to increasing engagement, optimising resources, supporting work-life balance and employee wellbeing.
About the Platform and Cloud Engineering
Deloitte "PACE" (Platform and Cloud Engineering) is changing how businesses leverage cloud-native technology to solve the toughest technology challenges our customers face! Our PACE team are thought leaders and specialists in API, Cloud and Container technologies. We accelerate digital transformation by unlocking the value of core systems at the heart of organisations to the many and varied digital channels required by modern applications. We work with our customers to create modern technology solutions that can be transparently run and managed in the cloud or by hybrid architectures.
Our Team
Come and join us if you are excited about the future of technology and want to build a future-proof career while working within a collaborative and supportive culture for an organisation that will invest in you.
Our team are united in their pursuit of technical excellence, passion for delivery, and aspirations to improve continuously. We are willing to think and work differently and ultimately thrive on winning as a Champion Team. Our team is lean, flat and skews heavily towards practitioners; we embrace Quality as a key differentiator in how we deliver solutions to our clients.
We are a local NZ team of 50+ engineers, and we combine this with 800+ PACE Engineers in Australia and many more spread throughout the world. Deloitte is an amazing global network where you can find an expert in anything, and learn from the best.
In addition to joining a fantastic team, you will receive an industry-leading remuneration package with benefits, like flexi-time, an award-winning parental leave package, a suite of learning and development opportunities (technical certifications, leadership and personal development), access to the global Deloitte tech community and unparalleled opportunities to engage with leading software vendors such as AWS, Microsoft, Salesforce, MuleSoft, and Red Hat.
As our team continues to grow and develop, we are now looking for Integration Developers with an API, Microservices, and Integration focus who are eager to challenge their technical and consulting skills with us!  
About the Platform and Cloud Engineering  
Deloitte "PACE" (Platform and Cloud Engineering) is changing how businesses leverage cloud-native technology to solve the toughest technology challenges our customers face! Our PACE team are thought leaders and specialists in API, Cloud and Container technologies. We accelerate digital transformation by unlocking the value of core systems at the heart of organisations to the many and varied digital channels required by modern applications. We work with our customers to create modern technology solutions that can be transparently run and managed in the cloud or by hybrid architectures.  
Our Team 
Come and join us if you are excited about the future of technology and want to build a future-proof career while working within a collaborative and supportive culture for an organisation that will invest in you.  
Our team are united in their pursuit of technical excellence, passion for delivery, and aspirations to improve continuously. We are willing to think and work differently and ultimately thrive on winning as a Champion Team. Our team is lean, flat and skews heavily towards practitioners; we embrace Quality as a key differentiator in how we deliver solutions to our clients.  
We are a local NZ team of 50+ engineers, and we combine this with 800+ PACE Engineers in Australia and many more spread throughout the world. Deloitte is an amazing global network where you can find an expert in anything, and learn from the best.  
In addition to joining a fantastic team, you will receive an industry-leading remuneration package with benefits, like flexi-time, an award-winning parental leave package, a suite of learning and development opportunities (technical certifications, leadership and personal development), access to the global Deloitte tech community and unparalleled opportunities to engage with leading software vendors such as AWS, Microsoft, Salesforce, MuleSoft, and Red Hat.  
As our team continues to grow and develop, we are now looking for Integration Developers with an API, Microservices, and Integration focus who are eager to challenge their technical and consulting skills with us! To be successful in this role, you will need to demonstrate the following:
Experience working on MuleSoft Integration Platform; or demonstrable experience working in a similar platform combined with a strong drive to learn MuleSoft.
Development, testing and production support of API integrations using Mulesoft;
Proven track record in supporting or developing on Cloud Native platforms (Red Hat Operating System, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure Cloud and Docker is highly regarded);
Experience and interest in solving the "hard" integration problems between enterprise systems. Knowing how to approach integration problems using API design patterns, messaging & pub/sub. Know how to build integration solutions that are robust and testable through the SDLC using integration testing, logging, tracing etc.
Passion for CICD practices using tools such as Github, Jenkins, Bitbucket and Azure DevOps;
Experience with Groovy scripting and Java frameworks - Spring is an added advantage;
Experience with logging and metrics technologies including Elasticsearch, Fluentd, Kibana, and Prometheus
Desire to collaborate, innovate, build reusable IP, learn and mentor through practice-wide coding dojos, brown-bags, hackathons etc. To be successful in this role, you will need to demonstrate the following:
Experience working on MuleSoft Integration Platform; or demonstrable experience working in a similar platform combined with a strong drive to learn MuleSoft.
Development, testing and production support of API integrations using Mulesoft;
Proven track record in supporting or developing on Cloud Native platforms (Red Hat Operating System, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure Cloud and Docker is highly regarded);
Experience and interest in solving the "hard" integration problems between enterprise systems. Knowing how to approach integration problems using API design patterns, messaging & pub/sub. Know how to build integration solutions that are robust and testable through the SDLC using integration testing, logging, tracing etc.
Passion for CICD practices using tools such as Github, Jenkins, Bitbucket and Azure DevOps;
Experience with Groovy scripting and Java frameworks - Spring is an added advantage;
Experience with logging and metrics technologies including Elasticsearch, Fluentd, Kibana, and Prometheus
Desire to collaborate, innovate, build reusable IP, learn and mentor through practice-wide coding dojos, brown-bags, hackathons etc. Next Steps
If you have the drive and passion to succeed, apply now.

Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated. Role type: Fixed Term
Location: Wellington
Job published on: 27 July 2022
We have multiple openings for a client in Wellington that is looking for savvy and passionate Java Developers. This a fantastic opportunity to join our ground-breaking programme of technical work.

Using your proven experience as a Developer, you'll use agile development methodology to develop, implement and support software solutions to create highly flexible product solutions. As a cross-functional squad member, you'll collectively own your product and have the opportunity to be involved in all aspects of the design, creation, testing and maintenance of the product as well as providing fail and fix application support. The squads are agile, impactful and collaborate effectively and efficiently, thanks to our strong focus on team culture, professional development and continuous improvement.

To qualify, you need:
Full stack development with experience in modern development methods including test-driven development
ReactJS and Typescript or similar
Kotlin or Java and Spring Boot or similar
Building web applications and APIs from scratch
Source control using git and GitHub
Experience in common tool chain elements such as Jenkins
Experience using AWS CDK or CloudFormation is desirable
Containerisation using Docker
Spatial skills would be advantageous e.g. GeoServe
If you have the qualifications needed, don't hesitate and click the APPLY button now or you may send your CV to gwen@prestoresourcing.co.nz Role type: Fixed Term

Do you love to break things? Enjoy making developers sweat as you perform some QA on their latest work? Keep reading!
Doubledot Media is a New Zealand-based company creating online tools and training for people looking to start their own online businesses. We’re based in Christchurch, but the majority of our team work remotely from various places around the world.
We have a full-time QA Analyst position available to work on SaleHoo.com and Affilorama.com.
You will play an important role by checking items in alpha and beta stages as well as reviewing the weekly release of our products. You'll be making sure the code that goes out not only works but also looks great.
Essential skills and abilities...
Excellent written English and a friendly manner in writing, a lot of communication is done via Asana/Slack.
Common sense and the ability to "read between the lines".
Meticulous attention to detail. Your spelling and grammar should be top-notch.
Good time management skills. Since this can be a remote working position, you'll need to be organized, motivated, and (dare we say) a "self-starter".
Understanding of websites/web applications and finding edge cases to break sites.
Able to accurately test websites in multiple browsers/OS.
Creating and running test cases on a daily basis.

And if you have any of the following, be sure to mention them when applying!
3+ years of commercial experience with web/software testing.
Experience using bug tracking tools (such as Test Lodge, JIRA, Trac or Redmine).
Experience/knowledge with automated testing software (Ghost Inspector, Selenium) and services.

Neat things about working with us:
Flexibility: Work flexible hours at home, from our Christchurch office, or anywhere in the world. No matter where you are, you’ll get the support you need for an engaging and enjoyable work experience.
Creativity: We promote an open work environment where every team member can share their ideas and be creative. Your input is valued, and your feedback is always appreciated.
Career Development: You’ll be encouraged to level up your skillset at every opportunity. We’ll cover the cost of any training and courses you need to create first-class products for our customers.
Ego-Free Work Culture: No dress code. No unreasonable deadlines. No micromanagement. We’re a diverse team from all over the globe. We hire the best people for the job and help each other improve through constructive feedback and support.
Cutting Edge Projects: You’ll be working directly on ambitious projects that help 100,000+ daily users from every continent get the most out of our products and reach their goals.
Sounds good? Here’s what you need to do to join our Doubledot Media team. Do you love to break things? Enjoy making developers sweat as you perform some QA on their latest work? Keep reading!

We are looking to recruit high calibre and talented graduates to join our growing global FinTech business. We are offering a highly attractive remuneration package, additional employee benefits, comprehensive training and phenomenal on-the-job work experience that will have you industry ready fast!
If you want a role that will challenge you and open up a world of global opportunities then we want to hear from you.
Who are we?
FNZ is a global FinTech firm, transforming the way financial institutions serve their wealth management customers. We partner with banks, insurers and asset managers to help people achieve their financial goals. We do this by providing services that span the entire wealth management value chain, from the digital user experience, client, account and portfolio management through to back-office trade execution, settlement and investment/member administration. Solutions are enabled for all client demographics from high-net-worth to the mass market.
Today, we are responsible for over £700 billion in assets-under-administration, held by around 12 million customers of some of the world’s largest financial institutions.
What do Analyst Developers do?
Developers at FNZ are all-rounders who design wealth management platforms, write complex financial business logic and create slick web applications.
They work closely with business analysts, testers and other members of the project team to produce world class software. Developers will be expected to learn all about our applications, the business and the global financial services industry we operate in.
About You
Confident, and able to take initiative in a delivery-focused environment
Independent, self-directing working style;
Ability to learn quickly in a dynamic fast-paced industry
Enjoy working as part of a high performance team
Hard-working, innovative and takes pride in their work
Passionate about creating innovative solutions for customers
What's in it for you?
Be part of a highly successful, rapidly growing, global business that is leading the delivery of financial services via cloud computing and partners with some of the world’s largest companies.
Remuneration and career advancement is based on individual contribution and business impact rather than tenure or seniority.
We provide significant financial rewards for high performing individuals.
We provide global career opportunities for our best employees at any of our offices in the UK, Czech Republic, Australia, New Zealand or China.Please note that we may begin shortlisting as we receive applications. We encourage early applications as we may withdraw the advertising at any time

From our offices, located on the foreshore of Tauranga Harbour, in one of New Zealand’s fastest growing regions, with over 1200 staff around New Zealand, C3 is a business on the go. C3 has an established and proud history in our industry and our longevity is based on building for the future and keeping ahead of the pack.
Our IT team works over a varied environment, ranging from traditional IT solutions, serverless cloud-based solutions through to mobile technology that supports cutting edge logistics systems that track our customers products across the world.
C3 are embarking on the development and implantation of a new Technology strategy as our industry moves to digitise the supply chain. Here at C3, we feel good strategy is powered by great people. We are looking for people who can solve business problems through innovative technology solutions and teamwork.
We are looking for an enthusiastic Senior Developer to help realise C3’s technology strategy through programme and system developments. As part of a small, focused team reporting to the Manager Solution Design this role will form a key part of the journey to modernise our IT systems.
The successful candidate will be required to cover four key aspects of this role: Project participation, software design, software development, and effective communication.
To be successful in this role we are looking for the following experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities:
A technology enthusiast – we are passionate about what we do and the technology that supports it, you should be too.
A keen interest in developing software and solutions for mobile, web, and backend environments.
Well-developed communication and listening skills to work within teams preparing project scopes, as well as internal and external customers to gain insight into their requirements.
Exposure to multiple development languages, notably JavaScript, as well as experience with web frameworks (notably Angular and React)
A clear understanding of SDLC and experience in using tools (notably Jira) to manage development environments in collaboration with other developers (team working).
A self-starter with strong skills in relationship development and stakeholder engagement.
Some experience in digital supply chains would be an advantage but is not essential.
A passion for developing clean, readable, and supportable code – we are not looking for a code robot, we are after a team player.
Along with the opportunity to work within a complex and rapidly changing industry, you will be rewarded with an attractive salary and development opportunities in an organisation looking at innovative ways of doing things.
Are you the one? We would be keen to hear from you if you think you have what we are looking for and desire to work for an industry leader, with a strong plan for the future, who rewards and develops their staff.
C3 supports the Government vaccination programme to help protect us all against Covid-19. Along with our pre-employment background checks, drug, alcohol and fitness for work checks, applicants will be expected to provide evidence of Covid-19 vaccination and booster as part of our recruitment process.
Applications will be monitored regularly and we may commence the interview process prior to the close date. If you are interested in this opportunity please don't delay your application.
Applications close on 23 February 2022.
