About the Role

This is a fun, challenging role within the Research and Development Team across our global businesses. We have over 100+ Flintfoxers working in New Zealand, Australia, United States, Canada, United Kingdom and Brazil - with further growth planned.


In this role you will accelerate the development and continued advancement of our exciting platform and product. We are looking for a talented Full Stack Developer who has experience and passion for web technologies and delivering beautiful, responsive and interactive solutions. You are someone who appreciates that design aesthetics and functionality go hand in hand.


You will work collaboratively with the stakeholders, architects, & team members to help design UI, front-end focused features along with server-side development integrating our core processes and workflows. You will be a team player who enjoys a role with responsibility and can also work autonomously to deliver results.


Flintfox is a place where you can flex your imagination in designing and developing industry leading features that are reliable and scalable while providing an excellent customer experience, creating something spectacular for our customers.


A Few Essentials for the Role

A minimum of 3 years' experience in web development
Solid experience with .NET Core and C#
Experience with HTML5, TypeScript, JQuery and CSS
Experience optimizing page performance and responsive web design strategies
Skilled in creating high-performance, reusable code applying SOLID principles
Experience with agile development practices & scrum project methodologies


Desired Skills

Learn new technologies quickly, embrace challenges and solve problems
Great customer focus and work ethic
A team player with a can-do attitude
Experience with Kendo UI and MVVM (or equivalent) is advantageous
We utilize some of the following technologies: OAuth 2.0, SignalR, OData, IoC, Git, Azure DevOps, T-SQL, MEF


Benefits

Flexible work from home policy
Health insurance
Employee Assistance Programme
Entitlement to staff discounts
Free parking and conveniently located in Albany on Auckland's North Shore
Work in a fast-paced, informal environment with a great bunch of highly, skilled, passionate people who freely share knowledge and a great team spirit
New product development, the opportunity to play a key role in the success of our product roadmap with the development of leading edge on premise and SaaS/Cloud based software
Career opportunities to grow your role and your skills as our product develops; future plans for the product include Microservices and advanced BI
Utilise the latest Microsoft and Azure cloud technologies.


About Flintfox


Why Flintfox? - watch this short video that defines what we do and who we are


Flintfox is an award-winning provider of expert ERP solutions and services globally. We love developing technology, but it's the impact it has on our customers that really excites us. We provide intelligent solutions which optimise trade revenue, pricing and promotions across a wide range of verticals. Our culture of collaboration and partnership enables us to continue to delight our customers with our software. We are a strong adopter of Microsoft technologies and a Microsoft Gold Partner being one of only a handful of Global ISVs for Microsoft Dynamics ERP solutions.


The prospects are boundless. At Flintfox you can be part of a company that is growing rapidly, building a product that users really value and love. Come and join us on the journey.


If you feel you have the skills and experience required for the position and wish to be part of our truly unique organisation apply now, and one of our team will be in touch.


For more information about what it's like to work at Flintfox check out our website www.flintfox.com/careers and our Instagram account: @flintfox.international


Flintfox is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Offers may be subject to satisfactory security clearance. All applicants will be required to provide proof of their eligibility to work in New Zealand

job_title: Java Developer (calling for grads to senior Java Developers)
listing_jobDesc:
Gallagher is New Zealand’s top privately owned tech exporter, and global market leader, focused on protecting what matters most to customers around the world.
Starting in the 1930s with a revolutionary idea for stopping Joe the horse from using the car as a scratching post, our 1000 strong team now protects some of the highest security environments, and agriculture businesses around the world. From prisons to palaces, universities to technology parks, government buildings to global businesses who are themselves developing leading edge (and secret!) products that are changing the world, we’re in 160 countries across the globe.
And we’re using – and creating – some of the world’s most exciting technology to do it. In the words of one of our team “We get to work on cool stuff every day and push the boundaries of what is possible in our industry.”
The role
We’re looking for a passionate Java Developer to join one of our cloud-based Small and Medium Business (SMB) security system teams. Our innovative new product protects what matters most for a huge new international market. The SMB teams are agile, highly responsive, fast paced, and creative.
The SMB teams have a strong cloud-first approach, and are focused on the rapid deployment of value, based on direct product and customer insights.
We work in a highly collaborative environment and believe in everyone having a voice. We have a strong focus on keeping up to date with technology and industry trends through mentoring, regular development seminars, conferences (when the borders allow it), and working alongside customers who encourage us to push the boundaries every day.
If you’re:
A creative problem solver, prepared to lean into the unknown and open to new learning
Someone who shares knowledge freely and cares about making things better
Motivated to write commercial software with a focus on code longevity and quality (including automated unit testing)
And if you have experience in:
Java and Spring Boot (or other modern OO language on an equivalent framework)
Web Services and RESTful APIs
AWS cloud services (or similar)
SQL databases – PostgreSQL (SQL Server or similar)
Working in agile product-focused teams
GoLang
What we offer
You’ll be joining a responsive future focused team of developers with a supportive, flexible work culture. It’s the culture at Gallagher that results in 94% of our people saying they are proud to work here.
By the way, did we mention we’re proudly based in the Waikato? Although many of our team live round here too (and love escaping the rat race), flexible working means you can live almost anywhere. When you’re in the office, we have free parking, subsidised on-site café and great eateries nearby.
We also offer:
Competitive salary and bonus opportunities, as well as company laptop.
Access to our community giving programme, enabling you to do some volunteer work, ask Gallagher to donate to an organisation you’re involved in, or take part in a corporate challenge.
Discounts at some of New Zealand’s favourite stores.
If you want to join a family-oriented environment, described by one of our software team leaders as one where “your point of view is respected and listened to, and you can really have an impact” then come and talk to us.
To ensure the ongoing health and safety of its people and continuity of its business, Gallagher requires that all new employees are vaccinated against COVID19 or have received an approved exemption. If you would like to discuss the available exemptions, please contact people@gallagher.com. Company Description
Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.
When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.
Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.

Job Description
At Visa, you will be a part of our diverse, dynamic, and passionate team of engineers to solve the many challenges and puzzles that come with our rapidly evolving technical stack.
You will be a full- stack engineer who is ready to work with new technologies and architectures in a diverse and inclusive organization that constantly pushes boundaries in enterprise FinTech. Here, you will take complete end-to-end ownership of projects across the entire stack.
You will learn new things at Visa and be encouraged to grow.
Participate in all aspects of agile software development, including design, implementation, deployment and operations.
Involved in the architecture and design of end-to-end systems optimized for speed and scale
Learn new ways of doing things as we evolve our product and development approach towards a cloud-first, test-first, build-it/run-it approach.
Collaborate with product, designers and full- stack engineers to build solutions for customers

Qualifications

7-10+ years’ experience in professional software development.
Experience with .Net Framework, .Net Core, AWS core services
Experience with most, if not all: RabbitMQ, Apache Kafka, SQL Server, JavaScript/Angular/React, Azure, Cloud, Docker, NoSQL databases, microservices, messaging sub-systems, security, data movement, etc.
Significant software engineering experience in designing and delivering enterprise level libraries, frameworks, web applications, etc.
Demonstrable communication skills: ability to effectively communicate your ideas, thoughts, and rationale to teammates and stakeholder engineering teams.
Understanding of the technical issues faced by product delivery teams and experience working with them to create robust, scalable, elegant, flexible, and relevant software solutions that enable further innovation.
Experience in the implementation of greenfield projects as well as the evolution of legacy systems and processes. Company Description

Understanding of the technical issues faced by product delivery teams and experience working with them to create robust, scalable, elegant, flexible, and relevant software solutions that enable further innovation.
Experience in the implementation of greenfield projects as well as the evolution of legacy systems and processes. Company Description
Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.
When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.
Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone. Job Description
At Visa, you will be a part of our diverse, dynamic, and passionate team of engineers to solve the many challenges and puzzles that come with our rapidly evolving technical stack.
You will be a full- stack engineer who is ready to work with new technologies and architectures in a diverse and inclusive organization that constantly pushes boundaries in enterprise FinTech. Here, you will take complete end-to-end ownership of projects across the entire stack.
You will learn new things at Visa and be encouraged to grow.
Participate in all aspects of agile software development, including design, implementation, deployment and operations.
Involved in the architecture and design of end-to-end systems optimized for speed and scale
Learn new ways of doing things as we evolve our product and development approach towards a cloud-first, test-first, build-it/run-it approach.
Collaborate with product, designers and full- stack engineers to build solutions for customers Qualifications

7-10+ years’ experience in professional software development.
Experience with .Net Framework, .Net Core, AWS core services
Experience with most, if not all: RabbitMQ, Apache Kafka, SQL Server, JavaScript/Angular/React, Azure, Cloud, Docker, NoSQL databases, microservices, messaging sub-systems, security, data movement, etc.
Significant software engineering experience in designing and delivering enterprise level libraries, frameworks, web applications, etc.
Demonstrable communication skills: ability to effectively communicate your ideas, thoughts, and rationale to teammates and stakeholder engineering teams.
Understanding of the technical issues faced by product delivery teams and experience working with them to create robust, scalable, elegant, flexible, and relevant software solutions that enable further innovation.
Experience in the implementation of greenfield projects as well as the evolution of legacy systems and processes. Show more

Solid Understanding of Linux/Unix Administration
Server Hardware Troubleshooting experience
Server Booting: POST, BIOS, PXE, Kickstart, GRUB/LILO, RAID
Some Experience with Network Protocols: TCP/IP, Ethernet, L2/L3 technologies
Network Hardware: Copper and Optical Fiber Cabling, Switches, Routers
Strong Communication Skills
Passionate about IT infrastructure and hardware!
Ability to cover 24x7 shift rotation

Job summary
Data Centre Operations (DCO) designs, installs and maintains the world’s largest Computing Infrastructure. We are looking for skilled Data Centre Technicians with a passion for technology to help us expand to the next level.

More about us

Amazon Web Services (AWS) offers exciting opportunities for personal development while delivering industry leading computing environments in a secure, scalable, and cost-effective manner.

In 2012, AWS S3 web service accepted its 1 trillionth object, currently accepting more than 40,000 objects uploaded every second on a daily basis. To keep up with this demand on both disk and capacity, we continue to expand our Data Centers in every region! Our content delivery service, Front, has expanded its Data Centre presence by over 50% worldwide in the last 12 months and are expected to continue increasing! This requires talented people to build and manage. We hope it is you!

The Opportunity: Data Centre Technician

This role is a unique opportunity to work with some of the most cutting edge data centers in the world. Amazon data centers are large-scale, high-density centers where you will be working on changing the face of technology in the region.

A Data Centre Technician can be the primary point of contact for both internal customers (for example: Engineers, Developers & Technical Operations) as well as external customers (Vendors, Contractors, & Service Providers). There is never a dull moment, as each day presents itself with different challenges.

Some of the key responsibilities you will undertake are:

Maintain a high level of system reliability by prioritising and resolving trouble tickets efficiently. This includes being the escalation point for all systems and problems, as well as resolving server issues & XEN service virtualisation troubleshooting.
Troubleshoot technical issues on various platforms ranging from Systems through to Power/Mechanical infrastructure. This includes the remediation of physical layer outages (both Systems & Network), recovery of physical power issues on racks and participate in Data Centre power and cooling events.
Participate in and deliver on a number of high impact small to mid-scale projects, including the reporting of metric analysis and project status updates to help build the world’s largest Cloud infrastructure.
About you

The ideal candidate must have a license and own transport in order to commute between our various data centers and happy to work on a rotating roster and commit to shift work, which includes rotating through weekends and evenings. More specific technical skills include:

Solid Understanding of Linux/Unix Administration (must have)
Server Hardware Troubleshooting experience (must have)
Some Experience with Network Protocols: TCP/IP, Ethernet, L2/L3 technologies
Data Center Operations: Inventory Management, Hot/Cold Aisles, Security
Experience or Knowledge of AWS products: EC2, EBS, S3 etc. (nice to have)
Scripting: Bash, Python, Perl, Ruby or other programing languages (nice to have)
Rotating Shifts

Our onsite technicians & engineers work on rotating rosters, that operate 4 days on and then 4 days off in our 24/7 data centers. A typical shift is 12 hours, and you will receive the same shifts in fortnightly blocks. Blocks will typically come in either Day shifts, Night shifts or Cover shifts for a total of 2 weeks, before rotating to another block. Please ensure you are flexible and able to work weekends, evenings and days in order to be a good fit for this role.

Remote Access: Console routers, IPMI, BMC
Network Equipment Installation and Configuration
Cisco IOS, NX-OS, JunOS
Redundancy: Power feeds, ATS, Server Hardware, RAID, Network Connectivity
Data Center Operations: Inventory Management, Hot/Cold Aisles, Security
Participated in Project Management
Experience or Knowledge of AWS products: EC2, EBS, S3 etc.
Scripting: Bash, Python, Perl, Ruby (or programming languages)This position also has a physical component requiring the ability to lift & rack equipment up to 20 kg; it may require working in cramped spaces or in elevated locations while adhering to health & safety guidelines.This role involves covering 24x7 shift rotationCandidates must possess a valid drivers licence and their own vehicle to travel between sites Solid Understanding of Linux/Unix Administration
Server Hardware Troubleshooting experience
Server Booting: POST, BIOS, PXE, Kickstart, GRUB/LILO, RAID
Some Experience with Network Protocols: TCP/IP, Ethernet, L2/L3 technologies
Network Hardware: Copper and Optical Fiber Cabling, Switches, Routers
Strong Communication Skills
Passionate about IT infrastructure and hardware!
Ability to cover 24x7 shift rotation

Totara is large global learning software business, started and still based right here in Wellington, New Zealand. We've been going strong for over a decade, and while not a household name in Aotearoa, we're pretty big in the rest of the world. We're known for our high quality, powerful and flexible learning management and talent development software, also known as the ‘Talent Experience Platform'. Totara's products are used by over 1,800 organisations around the world like the US Department of Agriculture (USDA), Pepsi, Red Hat, and Yamaha.
It's an exciting time to be in this space as the whole world experiences a shift in workplace dynamics following the impact of COVID-19. We're constantly evolving and adding new products to help develop, engage and empower workforces to adapt and thrive through continual change.
Summary
We are looking for a Senior Backend Developer, or an aspirational Intermediate Developer with a deep understanding of enterprise-quality web application development to join our Wellington-based Research & Development team.
Our open source Talent Experience Platform is deployed by our global partner network in corporations, government agencies, and organisations around the world. It runs in a wide range of environments, browsers, and devices, and is integrated with a large number of other systems. Our partners extend and customise our platform and products to meet the needs of their customers.
Our products need to be powerful and configurable for admins, but also simple and fun for non-technical users. They must perform well at scale, and be localised and accessible by default. We use and support the software that we produce, and take a lot of pride in the quality and robustness of the solutions we ship, and we have well-defined processes for testing and maintaining that level of quality and consistency across our teams.
The role
You'll join an established cross-disciplinary team in an agile environment following an outcome driven development methodology to identify and deliver value to our partners, subscribers and vendors. You'll be involved in all aspects of the solutioning and delivery and your past experiences and knowledge will be put to good use in helping us ensure we're taking the best possible approach and are continuing to deliver enterprise quality solutions.
The code that you write will be well architected, high quality, documented, and well covered with tests. Your team will support you, and you'll support them.
Where there are opportunities to align work to your interests we'll jump to make that happen. If upskilling is required we'll support you on that journey.
What we offer
Totara is what it is because of our people. Our goal is to provide the spaces and support for our people to do their best work, be recognised and rewarded fairly, and be celebrated as part of our team. Joining our team means joining the pursuit to create effective and engaging learning workplaces for all. We're growing and are looking for people who are excited about making an impact on the global stage and are passionate about working in the software product industry.
About you
You appreciate and value good communication and collaboration. Our platform and products are too complex for any one person to truly know. We strive to build high performing teams who can solve challenges together
You will have experience developing high quality web applications for large scale deployment.
You will be highly skilled in PHP, or be highly skilled in a similar language and willing to upskill. We've converted our fair share of Java, Ruby, Python and C# developers.
You won't be afraid to touch front end code and have a good understanding of the whole user flow.
You understand the best solution can take many shapes and forms. You can recognise and apply a variety of software development methodologies, principles and patterns.
You will have a very strong understanding of what good quality code looks like, and how to write testable code.
You engage and self motivate when presented with a challenge, but also enjoy discussing problems and solutions with your colleagues.
You are a highly effective problem-solver and skilled at working effectively with cross-functional teams in a matrix organisation
You are skilled at mentoring others and sharing your knowledge
Looking for a new challenge? We'd love to hear from you!
Please note: At present due to the immigration challenges we are only accepting candidates already living within NZ.
Our head office is in Wellington CBD, and we are looking to establish satellite offices in Palmerston North and Christchurch. This role can be positioned in any of these centres. Documentation / Technical Writer

R&D AUCKLAND

PERMANENT, FULL TIME
We are on the hunt for an experienced and passionate Technical Writer to join our super-talented team based in Grafton, Auckland to help us deliver great software outcomes for the customer service industry.

Our Technical Writers will be champions of delivering end user and production documentation that is clear, concise, and well crafted. They thrive on understanding how our software will be used in real world scenarios and ensuring we have the right information to provide a great customer experience.

Our people are part of our success. We offer a successful, innovative and customer-driven culture where you will be encouraged to succeed in your role. We know that by helping you to develop your strengths, we will benefit as a global organization and so will our customers.

Life is fast paced and exciting at Enghouse. The high achievers tend to be those who seize the opportunity and enjoy working in a team-based environment.
The Role
The Technical Writer is responsible for working closely with Scrum team members and other subject matter experts, proactively obtaining the information necessary to develop documentation deliverables within the timeframes agreed with the Product Owner. Operating as a technical documentation consultant for Scrum-based project teams, the Technical Writer is involved in all phases of the product development lifecycle, from requirements evaluation, development, and on through the testing, training and implementation of the product release.

You will have:

Formal qualification in Communication/Technical Writing, or 3 years minimum industry experience.
Must have worked within the IT field and as part of a software development team
Experience in MadCap Flare (or similar single source) help authoring tool
Knowledge of information mapping techniques
Knowledge of application help development processes
Ability to professionally create, maintain and provide input to:
Technical manuals
User manuals
Html help files
Technical release notifications
User release notifications
Technical information bulletins
Marketing material related to product releases and for user groups
Experience with translation processes is desirable
Specific exposure to HTML help files and Web development (the ability to understand html and CSS code is an added bonus)
Previous experience working within an agile software development environment, across sites and in direct contact with developers


You will be:

Professional
Adaptable/Flexible in attitude and task management
Must work well in a team environment and be able to assist others where required
Methodical and results driven
Excellent documentation and presentation skills
Good task and time management abilities
Good organisational skills
Ability to communicate well with technical and marketing personnel


You’ll spend your days (and some nights) working with other talented, energetic people who have a little pinch of zest and are the heart and soul of our business. We care about each other and foster a culture of innovation, authenticity and trust.
All data will be used in accordance with our privacy policy.
 #LI-EI8 Documentation / Technical Writer

The Technical Writer is responsible for working closely with Scrum team members and other subject matter experts, proactively obtaining the information necessary to develop documentation deliverables within the timeframes agreed with the Product Owner. Operating as a technical documentation consultant for Scrum-based project teams, the Technical Writer is involved in all phases of the product development lifecycle, from requirements evaluation, development, and on through the testing, training and implementation of the product release.

You will have:

Formal qualification in Communication/Technical Writing, or 3 years minimum industry experience.
Must have worked within the IT field and as part of a software development team
Experience in MadCap Flare (or similar single source) help authoring tool
Knowledge of information mapping techniques
Knowledge of application help development processes
Ability to professionally create, maintain and provide input to:
Technical manuals
User manuals
Html help files
Technical release notifications
User release notifications
Technical information bulletins
Marketing material related to product releases and for user groups
Experience with translation processes is desirable
Specific exposure to HTML help files and Web development (the ability to understand html and CSS code is an added bonus)
Previous experience working within an agile software development environment, across sites and in direct contact with developers


You will be:

Professional
Adaptable/Flexible in attitude and task management
Must work well in a team environment and be able to assist others where required
Methodical and results driven
Excellent documentation and presentation skills
Good task and time management abilities
Good organisational skills
Ability to communicate well with technical and marketing personnel


You’ll spend your days (and some nights) working with other talented, energetic people who have a little pinch of zest and are the heart and soul of our business. We care about each other and foster a culture of innovation, authenticity and trust.
All data will be used in accordance with our privacy policy.
 #LI-EI8 Show more

job_title: Expressions of Interest: Short Course Tutors
listing_jobDesc:
About the role:

If you have a passion for Creative and Technology fields and are eager to share that passion with others, this may be a great part-time casual opportunity for you. We are always on the hunt for a range of short course tutors to teach Micro-credentials, NCEA Credit Courses, Holiday Programmes, and other Professional Development courses.

We have multiple intakes and a range of campus and online programmes during the year so there may be further opportunities to facilitate more classes. We are looking for individuals with experience in one or several of the following areas:


Digital Marketing, UX Design, E-Commerce, Web Design
Video Editing, Special Effects and Practical Film skills (Adobe Premiere Pro and After Effects)
Graphic Design and/or Digital Illustration skills (Adobe InDesign, Photoshop & Illustrator)
2D,3D Animation and Game Development (Adobe Animate, Unity, C#)
Tech-based skills e.g., Cyber Security, AI & Machine Learning and Networking & Cloud Computing

About you:


You will describe yourself as enthusiastic, positive, patient, and a motivated self-starter who has a passion for sharing knowledge and trying new things. Your exceptional communication and time management skills, along with the ability to connect and build relationships will be the key to your success! Ideally, you will also have:


Industry experience and/or a Tertiary Qualification relevant to your skill area
Strong communication and delivering/presentation skills.
A flexible schedule and is best suited to working with casual hours.
Ability to converse with a range of age groups e.g., corporate and/or high school level.
An eagerness to share your knowledge, experience, and ideas with the class.
A NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa and a clean police record.
Even though it is not a requirement, prior experience in a tertiary education environment and/or teaching experience would be advantageous.

Who are we?


At Yoobee, we believe learning should be defined by the exceptional. New Zealand’s largest specialist creative and technology college; we’ve been fuelling the creative and tech industries for over 30 years with talented Animators, Filmmakers, Designers, Techies, and Game Developers. We offer online delivery, alongside our campuses based in Auckland, Wellington, Rotorua, and Christchurch.


To find out more about us, please visit https://www.yoobee.ac.nz/
Our application process:

Questions about your identity help us appreciate the diversity of individuals looking to work at UP Education, ensuring we’re attracting applications from people with identities and perspectives that are as diverse as our students. These are voluntary disclosures and candidates can elect not to answer these questions.
We are an equal opportunity employer. As part of our commitment to equity, we work to ensure a fair and consistent interview process. We celebrate diversity and we are committed to an inclusive work environment. About the role:

20986BR
Requisition Number:
20986BR
Description:
Communities are fundamental. Whether around the corner or across the globe, they provide a foundation, a sense of place and of belonging. That's why at Stantec, we always design with community in mind.
We care about the communities we serve—because they're our communities too. We're designers, engineers, scientists, and project managers, innovating together at the intersection of community, creativity, and client relationships. Balancing these priorities results in projects that advance the quality of life in communities across the globe.
The infrastructure industry is changing and needs a more digital focus. Help us leverage technology to change the way we do work for our clients.
The opportunity:
About the role:
Ideally based in our Wellington office reporting to the Design Technology Development Team Leader, you’ll be working across the NZ business on both Water & Transportation projects. We are looking for a developer who can build engineering add-ins and applications including Revit, Civil3d, AutoCAD, 12d and standalone applications.
Experience in developing web apps and JavaScript add-ins for office products is highly regarded and engineering experience would be useful but not essential.
Title:
Full Stack Developer
Qualifications:
Required Skills:
\tC#
\tCivil3d API
\tRevit API
Desirable Skills:
\tJavascript
\tAzure Management
\tBootstrap
\tAutoCAD API
\t12d development Experience
\tForge development Experience
About you
\tBachelor’s degree in Software Development, Engineering, or a related specialisation
\t2-5 years of related work experience.
Employment Type: Full-Time
Job Type: Regular
Job Category: Software Development
Preferred Specifications:
What we offer:
Along with a competitive salary we offer many other benefits to ensure your professional development & wellbeing is ongoing.
Flexible Working Arrangements including purchasing up to 4 weeks additional leave and provision for school term contracts, job sharing and part time working
Learning and Talent Development Programs including Global programmes, online learning and on-the-job learning
Mentoring for your own development and the opportunity to mentor others
Professional Memberships
Health Insurance – Income Protection Insurance – Life Insurance
Service Recognition Awards
Employee Assistance Program
Flexible Working Arrangements
How to apply:
Applications close Monday 22 August 2022
To discuss in more detail contact Glen Tarrant on 04 381 6729 or 027 4430 184 or apply directly online.
No Agency CVs will be accepted.
About Stantec:
The Stantec community unites approximately 25,000 employees working in over 400+ locations across six continents. We collaborate across disciplines and industries to bring water, transport and infrastructure projects to life. Our work from initial project concept and planning through design, construction and commissioning is built on a nearly 200-year history. So, when we take on a project, we see the opportunity to make a lasting connection with the people and places where we live and work.

DXC is a leading global provider of products, technologies, solutions and services to consumers and business. The company's offerings span IT infrastructure, global services, imaging and printing.
We invent, engineer and deliver technology solutions that drive business value, create social value and improve the lives of our customers.
As an Intermediate .NET developer, you will be assigned to our team supporting one of our key Government clients. This role will see you working within a larger team of Developers to deliver software solutions that conform to project quality and time expectations. This role includes responsibility for system analysis, design, development, testing and support. This is an Intermediate developer role and will make good use of your technical and business skills and your ability to grow into a more senior role in 12 to 18 months.


You will have at least 3 years’ experience delivering high quality solutions and this experience will include developing solutions based on Microsoft .Net MVC applications. You will have experience with C#, XML data formats, WCF/Web API experience with Visual Studio and Microsoft SQL server experience and Team Foundation Server/GIT. You will have experience working with development methodologies, an understanding of project management processes and experience with system and database management.
As we continue to move into a transformative future state, we are looking for candidates who have MS Dynamics CRM, MS Typescript, Azure development and DevOps experiences while exposure to Automation including CI/CD pipelines is desirable.
An ability to adapt to change, work under pressure and a results orientated approach will ensure your success in this role. This is a great opportunity to join DXC and take your career to the next level. We support multiple clients across the breadth of Microsoft technologies and are able to provide strong technical, career and leadership development opportunities.

Senior Software Developer

Lead the development of software capability, contributing to digital technologies which enable innovative project delivery, across the globe.

Be valued as subject matter expert – digital design products & services
Lead and shape software development and capability
Auckland preferred, (consideration given to other Beca locations)

Why Beca?

Our clients are transforming communities and changing lives. We are the problem-solvers – the thinkers, the creators, the planners and practitioners – who understand the vision of our clients and make things happen! As we progress through our second century, we’re excited about the fresh talent we’re nurturing, the innovative thinking we’re developing and the connections we’re forging.

The Opportunity

Our Digital Delivery Team plays a central role in leading digital transformation across the company, embracing change through an ongoing process of continuous improvement and adoption of agile practices.

The core purpose of this newly defined role will be to help with custom development of Autodesk products, enhancing current software capabilities and add-ons to increase productivity, standardisation and efficiency in the way we do things.

As software technical lead and solution architect, you’ll play a leading role in the development of our business, working with our internal clients and teams to deliver projects efficiently and lift capability. Sharing your software knowledge and expertise, you’ll help the growth of technical capability in the team. As the ‘go-to’ person who makes things happen, you’ll combine your technology and software subject matter expertise with your ability to create an environment for others to succeed and grow.

About You

In our environment of innovation and diversity, your collaborative communication and mentoring leadership style will add value. You’ll be confident to engage with our internal clients, exploring their requirements and leading technology-based discussions which drive innovative behaviours. Familiar with agile methodologies, you’ll enjoy coaching for proactive, flexible solutions.

Key technical elements for success include

Credibility as a senior software developer with Desktop application and cloud-based software products, web development, systems integration using APIs, distributed systems, software security and storage systems
Experience in a range of technologies, DevOps, typically C# .Net MVC, JS and with ability to read and understand VB, VBA, AutoLISP and Python
Experience with document management systems which integrate to vendor-based solutions
Experience using cloud computing services, specifically MS Azure and AWS to provide software solutions with high availability requirements and have a broad understanding of cloud solution architecture
An understanding of Autodesk applications such as AutoCAD and Revit will be highly valued

A career with Beca offers you

Opportunity to lead digital transformation across an extensive technology portfolio
A supportive, collaborative culture which values authenticity and diversity
Encouragement of balance in each aspect of your life, including opportunities to discuss flexible working arrangements

Could you belong at Beca?
Our people set us apart. If you’d like to join us, be at the forefront of transformational change, help us win business and ensure we continue to make everyday better, please apply online Senior Software Developer

A bit about us
ClearPoint is a digital design and engineering company, unlocking the potential of technology together.

We bring together everything that’s essential for creating great digital experiences – product and design that puts people at the center, fast and safe engineering that helps customers scale and integrated market-leading platforms in the cloud to help get more out of data.

Our diverse team of more than 180 strategists, innovators, engineers, architects, developers, and designers help solve complex business problems for many of NZ and Australia’s leading enterprises.

The ClearPoint culture
We’re proud of the collaborative and inclusive culture we’ve fostered at ClearPoint by ensuring we all live and breathe our values Respect and Care for People Act with Integrity Earn and Nurture Trust

Our diverse team enables us to better understand and serve our clients, attract the best talent and innovate successfully. So, from the moment you step through our doors, you’ll feel welcome and supported to do the best work of your life. Every day is a day of learning at ClearPoint and striving to be the best we can be.

Our head office in Auckland is a modern, functional space overlooking the Viaduct, and just a 5 minute walk from Britomart’s central transport hub. Everyone makes their space their own - whether it be a BYO device, comfy cushion or plant! We’ve also got offices in Wellington and Sydney, to cater to some of our clients in different regions.

The Role
Due to recent project wins and growth in our engineering capability, we're currently seeking a Frontend Software Engineer to join us and help us develop beautiful, accessible, responsive applications and UI solutions. We are looking for a software engineer who brings excellent understanding of front end development, design patterns, and experience working with cross-functional teams to deliver commercial web applications.

The ideal developer would have many (not necessarily all!) of the following experienceHTML and CSSJavascript (ES6/ES7)Knowledge of one or more frameworks/libraries such as React, Angular, VueUnit testing experience (Mocha, Jest, Enzyme)Developer tooling (Git, NPM/Yarn, Webpack/Rollup/Snowpack, Grunt/Gulp)Familiarity with TypescriptFamiliarity with design systems and component libraries such as Material UI or similarUnderstanding of CI/CD processes and automated testingExposure to cloud platforms (AWS, Azure)Experience with Nagios, Logstash, FluentD, Grafana, JenkinsGeneral web dev - HTML5 / CSS / Javascript

What’s on offer? Work on complex, interesting, challenging and market-leading projects every single day! There’s plenty of variety in the role, giving you the opportunity to carve your own path within ClearPoint. We offer competitive remuneration with a range of staff perks and benefits. We offer health insurance and subsidised gym memberships as well as access to yoga, massages, team dinners and lunches, a dog- and kid-friendly office, games room and drinks fridge, barista coffee, wellness workshops, free fruit, and lots of opportunity to take part in team sports and other events if you fancy. The opportunity to work from home/remotely. At ClearPoint we support flexible or remote working arrangements that enable you to balance your work, life and passions. We have a number of ways to help us all stay connected, regardless of where you’re working from - Slack and Google Meet are key! The opportunity to do award-winning work. ClearPoint was awarded the Social Impact Partner of the Year award at the AWS Amazon Partner Network (APN) Awards, in recognition of the innovative work that we did as the technology partner for Kiwi social enterprise, Eat My Lunch. In collaboration with Tech for Good New Zealand, we were also proud to take out the ICT-enabled community programme award at the 2020 CIO 50 Awards.
What you’ll be working with (tech, tools and more!) You’ll get to work across a broad range of cutting-edge technology. From front end React JS through to hard core Golang and (nearly) everything in between, there’s something for everyone. You’ll need to love being immersed in the tech, be passionate about quality and have continuous delivery flowing through your veins. Get access to whatever tech takes your fancy. We have a BYOD policy at ClearPoint. For our permanent staff, we provide a yearly BYOD allowance and a phone allowance, so you can choose the tech that best suits your needs. All our permanent staff get an annual training budget for courses and conferences. You’ll also get access to resources from a range of our partners such as AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft and Salesforce, including training platforms, partner portals, online courses and real-life practice. We also offer a range of lunch and learn sessions and tech community meet ups to foster networking and sharing of knowledge.
What’s next?
Sound like the opportunity you’ve been looking for? Please apply and one of our Recruitment & Resourcing team will be in touch for a confidential chat! If you’re based anywhere in NZ or Aussie (remote working options available), we’d love to hear from you. You must be eligible to work in New Zealand or Australia to be successful in this application. HYBRID JOB - WORK OUT OF OUR HEAD OFFICE IN AUCKLAND OR US OFFICE IN SEATTLE OR FROM THE COMFORT OF YOUR HOME
Celo is a secure healthcare messaging app that enables teams to communicate, enabling compliant and efficient messaging for better patient care. Celo is available on iOS, Android & Web.
Founded in New Zealand and used by some of the largest health providers, we've now expanded to the US, UK and Australia. We’re a fast-growing start-up, so you need to be willing to roll-up your sleeves and get stuff done. Your role will likely evolve as our company grows.

Currently, our development team is working on many exciting and technically challenging problems and we are looking for an Graduate or Junior iOS Mobile Developer to join us.
Requirements
ABOUT THE ROLE
Write great code for software used by healthcare professionals worldwide, which help them to save more lives.
Collaborate with team members to identify and implement continuous improvements to the development practice.
Be empowered to try things out and make a real difference for our team and customers
You don’t need to be a master at everything yet, just having some of these areas of expertise is great
REQUIREMENTS
1 to 3 years iOS experience
Passionate for modern iOS development
Comfortable with UNIX/LINUX Command Line Interface (CLI)
Practical knowledge and understanding of native iOS development
Swift, iOS SDK
Understanding of best practices for iOS development, such as MVC/MVVM design patterns
A focus on quality
Experience with source control such as Git
Experience working in an Agile environment
Willing to grow your knowledge and not afraid of a challenge
Benefits
Chance to join a fast-growing and exciting Start-Up that is taking on the world!
Improve patient outcomes and contribute to improving peoples lives!
Employee share scheme: You’ll own part of a company making a real difference!
Flexibility: We are hard-working and outcome focused, but recognize there is more to life than work. We promote a healthy work/life blend.
Personal development: We support our team to participate in courses, conferences, or events that will help them be relentless about improvement.
We’re a fast growing company so new opportunities regularly come up, whether it’s new responsibilities or entirely new roles.
Get ready to enjoy yourself while you do the best work of your life! Celo is a place where individual development and innovation are celebrated along with company growth. We value our people and want them to be open and take pride in their work. HYBRID JOB - WORK OUT OF OUR HEAD OFFICE IN AUCKLAND OR US OFFICE IN SEATTLE OR FROM THE COMFORT OF YOUR HOME

Company Description
Do you want job satisfaction where you can help develop new products and watch it grow from in the workshop to the end user? Be part of exciting new projects and work in collaboration with other divisions to achieve outstanding results. This role is your way to make an impact and join us on or growth phase and be part of something truly rewarding.
Who are TOMRA Food?
TOMRA Food designs and manufactures sensor-based sorting machines and integrated post-harvest solutions transforming global food production to maximize food safety and minimize food loss, by making sure Every Resource Counts.
Today, TOMRA is leading the resource revolution to transform how the planet’s resources are obtained, used and reused to enable a world without waste. The company’s other business divisions comprise TOMRA Recycling, TOMRA Mining and TOMRA Collection.
TOMRA has approximately 100,000 installations in over 80 markets worldwide and had total revenues of ~10.9 billion NOK in 2021. The Group employs ~4,600 globally and is publicly listed on the Oslo Stock Exchange. The company headquarters are in Asker, Norway.

TOMRA Food operates centers of excellence, regional offices and manufacturing locations within the United States, Europe, South America, Asia, Africa and Australasia.
Follow TOMRA Food on Facebook @TOMRA.Food, Twitter @TOMRAFood, Instagram @TOMRAFood and on LinkedIn at TOMRA Food.
For further information about TOMRA, visit www.tomra.com.

Job Description
Your role as a Senior Software Developer will include:
Building software that allows our customers to leverage the full value of our award winning fruit grading and sorting platforms. The software sits very much at the forefront of our exciting IIoT/Industry 4.0 initiative.
Work collaboratively within a very experienced set of software teams, and working closely with our teams of research, mechanical, electronic, and automation engineers, who are busy prototyping new machines, not to mention collaborating with our product management team.
Effectively communicate and resolution management
Being part of a global company also means you get to collaborate with our colleagues in Europe, Asia and America.
Being proactive, forward thinking and curious about how things work
Understand customers real problems so that you're building software that makes a real difference to them.
Open communication with customers and colleagues to foresee growth opportunities
 Some of the exciting work you will be part of include:
Work with real-time performance high throughput grading machine, right now the biggest application is to grade ~800 fruit per second.
AI (Artificial Intelligence) technology has been applied by the surface defect detection, greatly accepted by the market and customers, the name is smart-map
Deep Learning technology, has been applied to do blue berry sorting
Work with Insight, the cloud based platform to collect all data globally
Cut-edge spectrum based technology to sort the internal properties (e.g. brix) and detect defects (e.g. Internal browning), without destruct the fruit.

Qualifications
Experience and skills you can bring to TOMRA Food:
A positive approach, agility to achieve customer focused results along with enthusiasm and curiosity tops our list of requirements!
Appropriate software development qualification
4+ years' experience with C# or similar
2+ years' web development experience (.NET, HTML5, CSS3, Javascript)
Understanding of Solutions Architecture
Desired but not essential;
Familiar with virtualised environments and containerisation
Web and cloud development experience
Interest in Machine Learning and AI
Experience with C++
Additional Information
What can TOMRA Food offer you?
Award winning, innovative kiwi success story
Competitive remuneration package
Birthday leave – have a day off on us
Fantastic career opportunities locally and globally
Flexible work arrangements (Hybrid working)
Weekly Friday social and other events through the year
We invest in you with professional training and development
You can be based in either Auckland or Hamilton

A positive approach, agility to achieve customer focused results along with enthusiasm and curiosity tops our list of requirements!
Appropriate software development qualification
4+ years' experience with C# or similar
2+ years' web development experience (.NET, HTML5, CSS3, Javascript)
Understanding of Solutions Architecture
Desired but not essential;
Familiar with virtualised environments and containerisation
Web and cloud development experience
Interest in Machine Learning and AI
Experience with C++
Additional Information
What can TOMRA Food offer you?
Award winning, innovative kiwi success story
Competitive remuneration package
Birthday leave – have a day off on us
Fantastic career opportunities locally and globally
Flexible work arrangements (Hybrid working)
Weekly Friday social and other events through the year
We invest in you with professional training and development
You can be based in either Auckland or Hamilton
TOMRA Food is growing, do you want to be part of that journey? Share your passion for innovation and care for the planet by applying today. Show more

AlphaCert Labs is a global and growing company and the sister company of highly regarded technical engineering company ClearPoint. We are a New Zealand-based product company which started in 2012 building an Enterprise Data Management platform for the Investment Management industry. The AlphaCert platform provides a single source of clean, validated investment data, and part of our service is providing our clients with BA services along with investment management knowledge.

Which is where you come in!
We currently have an opportunity for a professional and passionate Senior .NET Developer who has over 5 years commercial experience working in the .NET framework and who can bring a good depth of knowledge and experience with web application frameworks like MVC.

What we’re looking for from you: A passion for .NET development A strong understanding of and experience with web 2.0 design principles and development methodology AWS and/or Azure experience Solid knowledge of architecture and design principles for modern web and cloud architectures AngularJS or similar single page JS framework Service Oriented Architectures or solutions Automated unit and integration testing strategy Continuous integration & delivery (Team city, TFS, Jenkins)

Sound like you? Keep reading!

Competencies & Capabilities
To be successful in this role it’s crucial for you to have great communication skills – written and verbal. Being able to proactively build relationships and trust with colleagues, you’ll have sound integrity and will naturally ‘do the right thing’. You’ll be an experienced problem-solving team player with a great eye for detail – and you’re a hard worker who isn’t fazed by change; your motivation will come from a passion for continuous improvement.

Our Values
Our AlphaCert values guide our thinking, underpin our behaviour, inform our decisions and define our anchor points. At a high level, our core values below make us who we are: People first Invested in our Customers Always moving forward

Inclusion & Diversity
Here at AlphaCert we understand and respect people’s individual differences. Our diversity within the team really makes us who we are and is critical to our successes every day. We embrace people from a wide variety of life, work experiences and backgrounds and challenge ourselves to continue to always be people and customer centric.

What's next?
Sound like the opportunity you’ve been looking for? We’d love to hear from you!
Please apply and one of our Recruitment & Resourcing team will be in touch for a confidential chat.
Ideally, you’ll be based in Auckland, but we will also consider remote working within NZ – though you’ll need to be open to the occasional travel to Auckland to collaborate with the team and meet clients.
Please note: you must be eligible to work in New Zealand to be successful with this application. Location: Wellington /Auckland

About Capgemini

Capgemini is a diverse collective of more than 330,000 strategic and technological experts based across more than 50 countries, partnering with world-renowned clients to transform and manage their businesses. We are dedicated to leveraging cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering, and platforms to address the entire breadth of their business needs. This passion drives a powerful commitment - to unlock the true value of technology.
Over the last 18 months, we have tripled our business in Australia and New Zealand, with over 3,300 team members devoted to helping clients get the future they want. Now is the time to join our rapidly growing team who are at the forefront of finding new ways technology can help us reimagine what's possible, collecting unique career experiences with global brands and game-changing tech projects.

Let's talk about the team:
Our Digital Customer Experience (DCX) team partner with businesses to help them adapt and respond effectively to the challenges of a constantly changing world, this is done by delivering thought leading transformational solutions. We're also a Salesforce global strategic partner, one of the largest Salesforce partners in Australia, a leader in the Gartner magic quadrant for CRM and have received numerous Salesforce Innovation Awards.

Within our Salesforce team we are continually driving customer value, by leveraging the power of the World's #1 Digital Platform. Our focus areas are Multi Cloud, Digital Agility and Enterprise Integration and Deployment.

Let's talk about the role and responsibilities:
In this role, you have the unique opportunity to be a foundational member of a new start-up business, building the Perth Salesforce practice from the ground up. With sponsorship from our executive leadership, this opportunity will provide the freedom to explore new innovative solutions to meet a variety of unique business challenges -with the depth and breadth of experience from Capgemini, a global Salesforce leader. Your day-to-day activities will involve in a wide range of activities - from pre-sales through delivery - with access to experts to support and guide you along the way. As a self-starter, your curiosity and passion for the right solution will drive you - and your high-quality development and attention to detail will be your key contribution to the delivery success of the team.

Salesforce Developer - (Lead Consultant)
As a Salesforce Developer, you'll work alongside a team of like-minded individuals within the Salesforce community and partner closely with our clients on a wide variety of collaborative and innovative engagements. You'll be:


Utilising your core consulting and Salesforce skills to offer technical knowledge and implementation experience with all core Salesforce tools, offerings, and products.
Active participation in development workstreams within projects.
Developing solutions to address any company-wide issues and making their processes more efficient.
Designing process and creating complex workflows and triggers.
Involved in APEX development, Lightning components and complex Salesforce configuration.
Working within the development team in analysing, designing, coding and unit testing Salesforce solutions.
Using your experience to guide our clients in best practices and better ways of achieving their goals.
Working alongside a team of talented technical Salesforce people, knowledge sharing and supporting each other to help each other develop your expertise in Salesforce.

Let's talk about your capability and experience:What we're looking for in Developers would be your:

Be able to proactively work in a fast-paced environment, as a team
Knowledge and experience in Salesforce platform, particularly across Sales Cloud, Service Cloud and Community Cloud and common AppExchange apps
Demonstrated understanding of underlying client business problems and the ability to develop Salesforce technology-enabled solutions that addresses their needs.
Extensive knowledge of all aspects of Salesforce declarative programming techniques.
Proven experience of Apex, Triggers, Classes and Lightning Web Components, and API Web Services
Ability to problem solve, coupled with a tenacious nature spurred on further by something not working as it should.
Capability to communicate with stakeholders, whilst also managing their expectations.
DevOps (Salesforce DX) experience preferred, including use of DevOps tools such as git.
Certification(s) in Platform Developer II; Sales; Service; or Community Cloud.

Let's talk about what's in it for you!

We believe technology is about more than business transformation - it's also about building a more sustainable, inclusive future. This starts with our people, working with you to get the future you want. We invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work, contributing to our inclusive culture and a safe place for our people to be themselves and truly belong. Through championing our staff-led community groups, we are committed to being active allies for everyone. We also aim to build an environment where you can thrive at work and at home. We champion remote working - even though you'll want to check out our beautiful offices - and are in the process of making ‘truly flexible' working arrangements the day-to-day reality for our people. In addition, we strive to ensure your growth and learning experience is unique with access to leading learning platforms, external certifications and opportunities to grow and learn the way you want. Finally, we offer opportunities to use your skills to help society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution, and we're ruthlessly focused on sustainability for our clients and our business - committing to becoming a net zero business by 2030.
We work to recruit and retain a talented and diverse workforce. We strongly encourage applications from suitably qualified candidates regardless of their gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, ability, intersex status or age.
Capgemini Australia has developed and manages, process orientated Management Systems compliant to the requirements of ISO9001, ISO27001 and ISO14001. We are committed to delivering secure solutions and services through state-of-the-art processes and continual improvement frameworks in line with industry best practices as well as contractual, statutory and regulatory requirements.
#GetTheFutureYouWant - Come join us, bring your whole self to work, create new possibilities for you, your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures.

Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered.

You want to change how work gets done. We're here to help you make that happen. We improve the way people work through process management and automation. Since the company's founding in 2006, our employees have helped customers and partners worldwide accelerate business results by digitally transforming workflows – thereby improving how people work.


About the Role:

Our Customer Support Engineer's are responsible for providing outstanding technical support focused on the overall success of Nintex's customers and partners. You will collect all relevant data required to effectively troubleshoot and understand how the customer is using our products. You will ensure that all Service Level Agreements are met, and that each customer has a positive experience with each contact.

Your contribution will be:

Technical Support and Product Expertise: Using the company CRM, Phone or Chat, interact with external customers and partners to resolve all technical issues with Nintex's products and environments where Nintex products are deployed. The role is required to use company and third-party training sites to grow knowledge and stay at the forefront of software technology stacks used by Nintex and its customers and become a subject matter expert.

Customer Engagement and Ambassadorship: The customers must be the central focal point in all interactions, and the role will act as the voice of the customer in all interactions ensuring all defined SLA's are adhered to ensure their continued success. In this role you must "know your customer", be able to identify the customer's technical ability, and customize messaging to ensure the customer has a clear understanding of what is being conveyed to them. The role will anticipate follow-up questions and provide additional documentation to proactively answer ancillary questions or future issues.

Replications and Knowledge Base: Use company virtual machines and tools to replicate complex customer scenarios, confirm whether behavior is unique to Nintex and document all results into defined Nintex department. On completion of all cases, the role will participate in knowledge base creation for internal and external consumption to reduce future in-bound case volume and same case issues.

Team success: Customer success starts with great teammate success. The role will take part in all team meetings sharing ideas and knowledge to grow the effectiveness of the overall global support department. The role must take equal ownership of periodic out of hours on call availability.

To be successful we think you need:

Microsoft certification in cloud technologies (nice to have)
Knowledge of Microsoft web server and development products (i.e. Visual Studio, IIS and IIS plugins)
Experience with salesforce as a user, power user or administrator
Experience with Nintex Promapp or Drawloop (a bonus)
Prior experience supporting applications that integrate with Salesforce
SQL developer experience - understand stored procedure, database design
APEX or SF Certifications
Customer Support Experience (min 2 years) supporting a SaaS product (ideally)

How we operate:

Everyone who works at Nintex follow three core tenets to ensure we operate a highly successful and collaborative business:

We deliver on our commitments. We focus on a few key priorities and ensure we deliver with quality every time…..on time.
We don't wait. If we see an issue, we fix it. If we see an opportunity to accelerate our success, we take it.
We operate with respect and consideration. We will move fast and deliver…and, we will do it the right way.

At Nintex, we thrive on helping our customers and partners succeed as they leverage the industry's best process management and automation capabilities to digitally transform a wide range of business processes. Every employee that joins Nintex is presented with a massive market opportunity to help improve the way people worldwide work as every organization needs what we provide. We have a highly collaborative culture where we focus on success through team efforts.

Unleash your potential. Apply today. You want to change how work gets done. We're here to help you make that happen. We improve the way people work through process management and automation. We’re still looking for a systematic and pragmatic Infrastructure and DevOps Engineer (Intermediate to Senior Level) to join the Springload whānau as a permanent team member.
Who we are

Mō tō mātou āhauatanga

The Springload Te Pipītanga whānau is the largest independent digital agency in Wellington. We encourage our employees to thrive at work and at home. We’ve got great clients, challenging projects, and a friendly workspace. There are always plenty of healthy snacks available, People’s Coffee brewing, and craft beer in the fridge.
What we do and why we do it

Ā mātou mahi ō mātou mātāpono

Our purpose is to make the things that matter better — better for people and for the planet. We follow a human-centred process, keeping the people we’re designing for at the centre of the work. We’re a multidisciplinary team, we collaborate closely with each other and with our clients on projects that make an impact on real lives. We celebrate different perspectives. We're committed to creating an equal, inclusive, and diverse workplace. We know we do better work if we have a diverse mix of people on our team. We're also a certified B Corporation — ethical and environmentally sustainable practices are a huge focus for us. We’re looking for someone who shares the same values.
We can offer you:

a whānau-friendly, flexible workplace, with the ability to work from home and we are open to exploring fully remote options within Aotearoa
a learning and growth budget to support your professional aspirations, and a wellness package to keep you physically and mentally fit including Southern Cross health insurance
highly talented teammates who strive to create world-class experiences that make people's lives better
opportunities to get involved in internal initiatives you care about, such as our sustainability group, waiata practice, and mental health chats
a base in central Wellington, Aotearoa New Zealand, near cafes, shops, theatres, and the waterfront.


About this role

Springload have a small, high functioning DevOps and Infrastructure team. As a digital agency we have a focus on efficiency and automation, with opportunities to work on a wide range of projects and platforms.

You will get to use industry leading tools and technologies, working with a variety of high performance teams to deliver robust, highly automated solutions.

For this role we generally prefer candidates with some background in development, and while formal qualifications are good, they're not essential. We value proven experience, analytical thinking and great communication skills. If this sounds like you but you don’t meet all the requirements listed below, please apply and tell us why your experience is relevant to the role.
Check out our github account for some of our tooling:

https://github.com/springload/ssm-parent
https://github.com/springload/ecs-tool
https://github.com/springload/terraform-aws-ecs-cluster


How we work

We use some great technologies to help us deliver efficiently and systematically, for example:

We make extensive use of Docker containerisation
We use IAC extensively and avoid any manual configuration
All of our development environments are containerised
We run production workloads on ECS, Azure k8s and other container runtimes
CI/CD: we use CircleCI and Github Actions primarily
We favour managed survices and reducing the surface area of services we have to manage


As an Infrastructure and DevOps Engineer you’ll:

work with teams, architects and developers to design and build scalable, secure and redundant infrastructure solutions on public cloud platforms.
Design, build and maintain highly automated CI/CD pipelines and cost efficient, secure and performant hosting environments using Infrastructure as Code
collaborate with cross-functional teams to build Developer Experience focussed solutions that enable developers and deliver cost effective solutions for our clients
continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency
have a keen attitude towards learning new technologies and frameworks.


Essential Technology Skills:

Public Cloud (Primarily AWS), especially IAM Roles and Security groups
IAC: We use Terraform and Pulumi either of these or a similar tech should be fine
Networking
Shell Scripting
Linux, we generally use Alpine or Debian derivatives
GIT and other VCS software
Docker
Web Servers, primarily NGINX
HTTP protocol especially headers


Useful technology skills:

Development experience, ideally with node, TS, Python or Ruby
Golang
Nginx
IAC: Terraform, Pulumi
SQL and database technologies: Postgres, MySQL
Debugging, logging and monitoring skills


Other experiences we'd love

Great team-working skills
Estimation
Great communication skills: the ability to articulate your ideas and plans well, both verbally and in writing, to diverse audiences.
A systematic approach to problem solving
A high degree of empathy


Remote Candidates

Springload is based in Wellington and we support remote working, currently the role is only open to candidates resident in New Zealand.
Timeline
Te Rārangi Wā

We’re excited to welcome a new team member as soon as we can. Once you apply, you can expect to hear back from us within a couple of weeks if you’re selected for an interview. We’ll keep you informed every step of the way.

How to apply

Please talk about how your experience relates to the job description in your CV. We’d also love you to include a cover letter and tell us a bit more about yourself and why you’d like to work at Springload.
We are happy to share this role is on the New Zealand Immigration Green list under Software engineer ANZSCO 261313.

If you have any questions, get in touch
Mehemeo he pātai āu, whakapā mai

Please apply online, but if you have any questions about the role, you can email us at apply@springload.co.nz or chat to us via our LinkedIn, Instagram, and Facebook. About OnFinality
OnFinality is a SaaS platform that provides infrastructure and developer tools that saves developers hours and allows teams to grow with confidence. We provide easy to use infrastructure automation tools to hundreds of customers globally. We also run a reliable, scalable, and globally distributed infrastructure handling billions of daily requests that most applications in Polkadot rely on.
Our mission is to help blockchain and dApp developers build the decentralised future faster.
About the Role
We’re looking for someone to join our growing team as we build infrastructure management tools and services for blockchain teams around the world. Even though our customers are in blockchain, we build and manage a huge number of interactive applications designed to make managing this infrastructure easier.
Our focus is building intuitive applications that make the lives of our customers easier.
You will be responsible for
Designing the end-to-end experience and user interfaces across websites and web applications.
Working on creating new features or redesign existing experiences based on quantitative and qualitative insights.
Guiding the team's decisions to create a cohesive user journey and usable information architecture.
Collaborate with developers to help create and evolve design and solutions.
Establishing and implementing design systems across our three brands
What we are looking for
Intermediate level experience as a product/UX designer.
Excellent prototyping skills and can design all stages of the product design lifecycle from user flows, to wireframing and UI execution.
Excellent collaboration skills and experience with stakeholders and development teams.
Highly self-motivated, ability to work autonomously and proactively and attention to detail
Nice to have
Experienced in running and participating in discovery workshops, customer journey mapping workshops, and user interviews
Experienced in writing for UX.
A portfolio that showcases your design skills and demonstrates innovation, and problem-solving skills.
Understanding or interest in the evolving web3 space, its product challenges, blockchain applications and token economics.
You can expect
To join our two other designers in our growing team of 30 to ensure that we remain a design led product development company, and that excellent user experience is provided for each and every new feature or application
To work in a well funded workplace where we use all the modern tools to solve problems for thousands of users around the world.
A flexible work environment where we trust our team with high degrees of autonomy and the option to work from home or from our office at the top of Auckland CBD.
You’ll be playing a critical role in a leading web3 company. About OnFinality

Job Posting End Date
September 9, 2022
Job Location
Christchurch
Job Description
The Opportunity:
We are looking for a talented Salesforce Developer/Administrator to join our team. Fulton Hogan is increasing the number of applications and data in force.com as the platform is the primary tool for mobile data capture for field workers. We have exciting new projects ongoing and in the pipeline. The position would preferably be based at our Corporate Office in Christchurch however working remotely (within New Zealand and Australia) would be considered for the right candidate.
Your responsibilities will include some of the following:-
Understand the FH Force.com implementation (customisation and configuration)
Become familiar with and utilise the internal tools, development processes and team structure
Support existing applications with bug fixes
Build business workflow and interfaces using Force.com configuration tools to requirements
Scope and deliver minor enhancements to application code for existing applications
Build new interfaces for Force.com applications using Lightning Web Components
Build customer and employee portals using LWC
Enhance and create integration with external systems
Complete Deployments and manage IP using Git and Salesforce developer tools
Assist in gathering and documenting user requirements and user stories
What we need from you:-
Good communication with customers and internal teams
Hand on development and or Admin experience with Salesforce Platform
Able to understand requirements and deliver quality solutions
Already have or be willing to learn some of the following:
Salesforce Admin experience
Configuration of SF Platform for business needs
Business Analysis skills and project facilitation
Build Flows to implement business logic
Declarative development in SF Classic, Lightning and Skuid
Developer skills using LWC, Apex and Visual Force for Desktop and Mobile
Implementing and configuring Salesforce Communities, especially B2B and B2E
Javascript frameworks for web eg. node.js
Integration tools eg. Data Loader, DBAmp and Dell Boomi
MSSQL queries and stored procedures
Salesforce Admin or Developer Certifications
What we offer in return:
We have a great team culture and supportive work environment here in Fulton Hogan. Along with a competitive remuneration package, you will also receive:
Life Insurance plan from day one
Medical Insurance for you and your immediate family from day one
Increased Kiwi saver employer contribution rates over tenure milestones for enrolled employees
Excellent fuel and a wide range of retailer discounts
Access to free confidential counselling and support services for you and your family
Fulton Hogan Philosophy
We build and maintain critical infrastructure that connects and enhances communities across Australia, New Zealand and the Pacific. Everything from roads and bridges, to airports and utilities. We’re committed to ensuring the Good Work we do will make a positive difference to the quality of life for our people, our customers and the communities we all call home. Our continued success relies on generating new and diverse ideas, which is why our ‘Good Work’ culture encourages ownership and empowerment, while never forgetting the importance of balancing life’s priorities.
Sound like you?
If this sounds like and you would like to help build on our Good Work culture, then we would like to hear from you.
All successful candidates must under-go and pass a pre-employment medical and drug screen.
We celebrate and embrace diversity across our business and are committed to equal employment opportunities.
We believe in the value that diversity brings to our team and people who share our REAL values are encouraged to apply Job Posting End Date
