Te Reo Tātaki (TVNZ) translates to "the leading voice" and our kaupapa (purpose) is to "inspire the conversations of Aotearoa." Each day TVNZ reaches more than two million Kiwis through channels TVNZ 1, 2, DUKE and our digital entertainment platform, TVNZ+. TVNZ's news site 1news.co.nz and our digital news youth brand Re: ensure we connect with people on the issues that matter to them wherever they are.

The opportunity - Te tūranga

Working in an agile, squad-based environment you will enable quick, safe and efficient iteration and deployment of platform improvements. You will support the Technology Online platforms to deliver robustness, performance and integrity to ensure that end customers always have the best possible experience of TVNZ platforms.

What we're looking for - Tā mātou e kimi nei

We are looking for a software engineer who can span the worlds of code development and systems operations.

Maybe you are primarily a systems engineer with strong Linux, networking and server skills who also has some experience with software development. Or maybe you are a software developer who has a stronger than normal understanding of deploying software into production, building automated deployment pipelines, and similar non-coding skills.

It would be good if you had cloud experience (AWS) but if not, you'll get lots of exposure to the cloud in this role. You would be excited by the idea of cloud native systems, continuous delivery and automated testing

To be successful in this role, you will

Have experience building and operating code/ infrastructure build and deployment pipelines to support incremental deployments
Strong Amazon Web Services experience with knowledge of creating cloud formation templates to build AWS services
Ability to design, deploy and administer hardware. storage and networking in Linux environments (physical, virtual and cloud)
Ability to write and debug scripting for the purposes of automation. monitoring and analysis.
Experience with Video on demand services and streaming protocols (RTMP, HLS, etc)
Experience with using Version control systems (Bitbucket. etc)
Experience with automation/configuration management tools (Ansible, etc)
Proficient in use of server monitoring tools (HW. virtualization. operating system and application level) for gathering and analysing system data and drawing logical conclusions.
Strong experience with web technologies (web HTTP. TCP/IP. DNS. load balancing, etc)
Knowledge of SOL and MySOL database configuration and troubleshooting (NoSOL experience is a plus. too. since we also use Redis & AWS Dynamo)
A working understanding of code and script (PHP, Perl and/or Ruby)
Key personality traits we are looking for are enthusiasm, a collaborative working style, and great communication skills

Working at TVNZ - Te mahi ki Te Reo Tātaki

A vibrant culture where we celebrate our content and our successes, and where we're encouraged to continue learning and growing our careers.
A $350 up front allowance to contribute to home office set up expenses.
Comprehensive parental leave - topping up the Government's offering to 6 months at full pay, as well as 6 weeks working at 80% of your normal time at full pay when you return to work, plus 4 week's paid leave and an optional extra 2 week's unpaid for partners.
Lifestyle Leave - the option to buy an extra week or two of leave annually if you want it, to take leave without pay if circumstances allow, or to cash up leave if you've got more than you need.
A $350 annual wellbeing allowance, discounted Southern Cross health insurance, free flu shots, and access to a confidential support, guidance and counselling service.
Superannuation covered - with employee contributions matched up to 5% of salary.
Hauora Leave - A bonus 5th week off annually to find your balance and focus on you - whether that's by connecting with whānau, taking time for yourself, or escaping the everyday.
A new Broadband and Mobile benefit offer so you'll be able to work from anywhere and be free to stream and binge watch with no limits.

If you would like to find out more about this amazing opportunity, please feel free to call our Head of Talent Acquisitions, Philly Irvine, mobile 021 564 691, she loves to chat about new careers.

Join the Online Channels domain, at the forefront of digital banking, to build products that help move us towards BNZ's aspiration to be a digital-first, human where it matters bank that works for all our customers. Auckland based.

He Waka Eke Noa | Creating Great Together

Here at BNZ, it's about more than just banking. We work together in an agile, energising environment to create innovative solutions that won't just help our customers be good with money, but also do great things with it.

Online banking has changed the way our customers bank and the way we engage with our customers. Here we have an opportunity for an Intermediate Automation Tester in one of our cross-platform teams in our Online Channels domain, who are focused on their mission to re-platform the existing website, whilst offering meaningful experiences to customers on bnz.co.nz.

Mō te Tūranga | About the Role

You will be responsible for assisting agile teams to deliver quality working software on a frequent basis to enhance the bank's competitive advantage. Day to day this includes:

Thinking critically and laterally about test automation, mitigating project risks through an appropriate test approach, and exploring the application to expose vulnerabilities beyond the business requirements.
Working with developers to create appropriate automated checks using existing tools
Working with their agile team to develop a common understanding of the business requirements, and understanding underlying business intent, business procedures and systems.
Clearly communicating defects.

Ōu Pūkenga | About You

At BNZ we are as much focussed on your skill sets today as your ability to adapt to change and learn new skills as required.

You'll be a team player who has excellent communication skills and a continuous improvement and innovation mindset. You will also bring experience with:

Testing responsive web applications.
UI automation using JavaScript and Cypress.
Experience with Silverstripe or similar CMS testing.
Ability to read logs and debug.

Desirable experience:

Mobile application testing
Web services and microservices automation
CI/CD understanding, support (Jenkins)
Postman
Web accessibility testing
Using Docker/Kubernetes/OpenShift containers
AWS Cloud infrastructure experience
SQL experience

BNZ Hei Wāhi Mahi |Working at BNZ

At BNZ, we're passionate about building and sustaining a high-performance culture that motivates our people to deliver exceptional results.

We know that every BNZer is unique, with a wide range of goals, ambitions, and lifestyles, so we offer a wide range of benefits and working styles to suit you.

Oranga | Wellbeing: Your wellbeing is important to us. When we're at our best, physically and mentally, in and out of work, we can truly create great things together. We're here to support you to be your best with a number of wellbeing initiatives.
Whakatā | Leave: We all need a bit of time off every now and then. At BNZ we're proud to offer the generous leave options you need and deserve - whether it's for a special occasion, an unexpected event, or an extended vacation.
Whakatā | Flexibility: We're big on helping you balance life and work. We offer a range of flexible working options that help you be your best, wherever you're based. Talk to us about how we can make this work for you.

Haere mai ki Te Peke o Aotearoa | Come to the Bank of New Zealand

This is an exciting opportunity to join us! BNZ is an award winning, forward-thinking, diverse and inclusive organisation with an ambitious change agenda. We're bold thinkers who are taking brave steps to create a company that people want to work for, and customers want to bank with. If you're ready to progress your career with BNZ, apply now and help more New Zealander's be good with money, so they can do great things with it.

Please note applications close Friday 26 August 2022. Join the Online Channels domain, at the forefront of digital banking, to build products that help move us towards BNZ's aspiration to be a digital-first, human where it matters bank that works for all our customers. Auckland based.

BNZ Hei Wāhi Mahi |Working at BNZ

At BNZ, we're passionate about building and sustaining a high-performance culture that motivates our people to deliver exceptional results.

We know that every BNZer is unique, with a wide range of goals, ambitions, and lifestyles, so we offer a wide range of benefits and working styles to suit you.

Oranga | Wellbeing: Your wellbeing is important to us. When we're at our best, physically and mentally, in and out of work, we can truly create great things together. We're here to support you to be your best with a number of wellbeing initiatives.
Whakatā | Leave: We all need a bit of time off every now and then. At BNZ we're proud to offer the generous leave options you need and deserve - whether it's for a special occasion, an unexpected event, or an extended vacation.
Whakatā | Flexibility: We're big on helping you balance life and work. We offer a range of flexible working options that help you be your best, wherever you're based. Talk to us about how we can make this work for you.

Haere mai ki Te Peke o Aotearoa | Come to the Bank of New Zealand

This is an exciting opportunity to join us! BNZ is an award winning, forward-thinking, diverse and inclusive organisation with an ambitious change agenda. We're bold thinkers who are taking brave steps to create a company that people want to work for, and customers want to bank with. If you're ready to progress your career with BNZ, apply now and help more New Zealander's be good with money, so they can do great things with it.

Please note applications close Friday 26 August 2022. Join the Online Channels domain, at the forefront of digital banking, to build products that help move us towards BNZ's aspiration to be a digital-first, human where it matters bank that works for all our customers. Auckland based.

He Waka Eke Noa | Creating Great Together

Here at BNZ, it's about more than just banking. We work together in an agile, energising environment to create innovative solutions that won't just help our customers be good with money, but also do great things with it.

Online banking has changed the way our customers bank and the way we engage with our customers. Here we have an opportunity for an Intermediate Automation Tester in one of our cross-platform teams in our Online Channels domain, who are focused on their mission to re-platform the existing website, whilst offering meaningful experiences to customers on bnz.co.nz.

Mō te Tūranga | About the Role

You will be responsible for assisting agile teams to deliver quality working software on a frequent basis to enhance the bank's competitive advantage. Day to day this includes:

Thinking critically and laterally about test automation, mitigating project risks through an appropriate test approach, and exploring the application to expose vulnerabilities beyond the business requirements.
Working with developers to create appropriate automated checks using existing tools
Working with their agile team to develop a common understanding of the business requirements, and understanding underlying business intent, business procedures and systems.
Clearly communicating defects.

Ōu Pūkenga | About You

At BNZ we are as much focussed on your skill sets today as your ability to adapt to change and learn new skills as required.

You'll be a team player who has excellent communication skills and a continuous improvement and innovation mindset. You will also bring experience with:

Testing responsive web applications.
UI automation using JavaScript and Cypress.
Experience with Silverstripe or similar CMS testing.
Ability to read logs and debug.

Desirable experience:

Mobile application testing
Web services and microservices automation
CI/CD understanding, support (Jenkins)
Postman
Web accessibility testing
Using Docker/Kubernetes/OpenShift containers
AWS Cloud infrastructure experience
SQL experience

Innovate with purpose

Do you want to work for a company that is innovating and making a difference to the health and wellbeing of people all over the world? We're not about selling meaningless, unnecessary products for corporate profitability. You'll be working on technology that will revolutionise global health systems so that we can finally get the healthcare we all want - a basic human right.

We like to think of ourselves as a community of start ups where you can be your true, genuine self. Each of our product teams have the autonomy to decide how they operate and contribute towards our mission of providing each person with the right care at the right time and in the right place.

Orion Health is excited to be expanding our galaxy by recruiting for a number of stellar individuals to join our team to help us deliver to our global customer base. If you want to climb aboard the rocketship and help us revolutionise global health systems, astronomical opportunities await.


What will you be doing?

We are on the hunt for an experienced Front End Developer to join our Auckland Digital Front Door team.

Orion Health's digital front door is a secure, open, and scalable platform that enables organisations to bring new and existing patient engagement technologies together into a unified, user-friendly hub.

As a Senior Front-End Developer in our Digital Front Door team, you'll be building functional, intuitive and beautiful web-based applications, working primarily on exciting new digital healthcare products. In addition, software integration with third party providers and existing Orion Health products will be a focus.


What will you bring to the role?

Experience: You are a web developer with commercial and single-page application experience, with a solid understanding of software architecture and design. You will have used agile working practices to analyse, design, troubleshoot, and modify complex software products. You will be no stranger to technical leadership and will be confident in mentoring and growing junior developers.
Must have skills: You must be familiar with technologies and tools including:
React Redux (or similar)
JavaScript or TypeScript
HTML, CSS
Modern web software architecture frameworks, using RESTful APIs
Troubleshooting skills
Nice to have skills:
Familiarity with AWS services (EC2, ECS, Pinpoint, Kendra etc.)
Containerisation (Docker)
Agile development
Content management systems (Strapi)
Java
Characteristics: You like to get stuck in, and have a positive, open-minded and energetic attitude. You have an eye for detail, enjoy understanding how things work under the hood, excellent communication skills, and thrive in a collaborative, professional work environment.


What's in it for you?

Health Insurance (eligibility applies).
Ability to top up your standard annual leave balance with LeavePlus.
Work for up to 30 days per year in another country through our TravelFlex initiative.
You'll use the latest languages and platforms and will be joining the ranks of the most talented and experienced tech workers in the industry.
Our relaxed, open plan offices have a vibrant and energetic atmosphere. We also have a casual dress-code so you will feel as comfortable in the office as you would at home.
Flexibility is important. We encourage our people to design a workday that suits them by offering flexible working arrangements.
Love food and coffee? We provide free breakfast and fruit every day and have a barista coffee machine in the office - not to mention the onsite cafe discount!
With weekly Friday drinks and an active social club, Orionites are never short of good times and we pride ourselves on our fun community.
We support our Orionites keenness to learn and grow by providing unlimited access to LinkedIn Learning. Innovate with purpose

Job Title: Senior Software Developer
Reports to: CPO
Works directly with: Product and development team / CTO

Job Purpose: You are part of a team that provides outstanding technology solutions. You are responsible for the research, specification, design, development, testing, deployment, documentation and support of elegant, innovative and robust technology applications specializing in cloud-based applications and solutions on behalf of the company and customers.

Nomos One

Nomos One is on a mission to enable the world of lease management and lease accounting. We are a fast-growing company with a head office in Dunedin, New Zealand. Serving a global market with a software as a service solution, that enables centralised, digitized and automated efficiency. For businesses that use leasing as a core asset procurement tool.

Senior software developer overview

The need for experienced JS developer capabilities is increasing as the company expands and scales its offering.

Description of Duties
Develop software solutions by studying information needs; conferring with users; studying systems flow, data usage, and work processes; investigating problem areas; following the software development lifecycle.
Determines operational feasibility by evaluating analysis, problem definition, requirements, solution development, and proposed solutions in relation to cloud based applications.
Ensures that all development artefacts (source code, scripts and documentation) meet Nomos One’s software required development standards, including peer code review.
Improves operations by conducting systems analysis; recommending changes in policies and procedures.
Updates job knowledge by studying state-of-the-art development tools, programming techniques, and computing equipment; participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organisations.
Can accomplish engineering and organisation mission based on agreed objectives.
Respect and support all internal teams such as Sales, Support, Customer Services, Finance, Marketing and Management teams.
Required Technical Skills / Experience
Amazon Web Services
AWS Lambda, Fargate, Codepipeline
Docker
Node JS
React JS
NoSQL
Micro services
Relational Databases
Skills/Qualifications
Minimum of 5 years’ experience developing software applications
Bachelor’s (3 years) degree majoring in a technical field such as computer science or engineering
Experience of being in a leadership position
Contact

Job Purpose: You are part of a team that provides outstanding technology solutions. You are responsible for the research, specification, design, development, testing, deployment, documentation and support of elegant, innovative and robust technology applications specializing in cloud-based applications and solutions on behalf of the company and customers.

Nomos One

Nomos One is on a mission to enable the world of lease management and lease accounting. We are a fast-growing company with a head office in Dunedin, New Zealand. Serving a global market with a software as a service solution, that enables centralised, digitized and automated efficiency. For businesses that use leasing as a core asset procurement tool.

Senior software developer overview

The need for experienced JS developer capabilities is increasing as the company expands and scales its offering.

Description of Duties
Develop software solutions by studying information needs; conferring with users; studying systems flow, data usage, and work processes; investigating problem areas; following the software development lifecycle.
Determines operational feasibility by evaluating analysis, problem definition, requirements, solution development, and proposed solutions in relation to cloud based applications.
Ensures that all development artefacts (source code, scripts and documentation) meet Nomos One’s software required development standards, including peer code review.
Improves operations by conducting systems analysis; recommending changes in policies and procedures.
Updates job knowledge by studying state-of-the-art development tools, programming techniques, and computing equipment; participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organisations.
Can accomplish engineering and organisation mission based on agreed objectives.
Respect and support all internal teams such as Sales, Support, Customer Services, Finance, Marketing and Management teams.

AWS Lambda, Fargate, Codepipeline
Docker
Node JS

NoSQL

Role and Responsibilities
The airline industry faces pressures like few others - already tight margins, innovative airlines are now having to reimagine their economics and intelligent technology is at the heart of this transformation. We unleash insights for high performance crews through powerful optimization and mobile automation software. We ensure 1.5 million flights a year (and growing). We have exciting plans for growth and innovation as we are now part of the global CAE group.
CAE is a high technology company, at the leading edge of digital immersion, providing solutions to make the world a safer place. Backed by a record of more than 70 years of industry firsts, we continue to reimagine the customer experience and revolutionize training and operational support solutions in civil aviation, defence and security, and healthcare. We are the partner of choice to customers worldwide who operate in complex, high-stakes and largely regulated environments, where successful outcomes are critical. Testament to our customers’ ongoing needs for our solutions, over 60 percent of CAE’s revenue is recurring in nature. We have the broadest global presence in our industry, with approximately 10,000 employees, 160 sites and training locations in over 35 countries. www.cae.com
ABOUT THE ROLE:
CMS is looking for a dynamic lead software engineer that can work up and down the technical solution. Someone who can hit the ground running with the existing team on complex airline problems and move into growing and leading their own team. CMS work in a complex space delivering aircraft, crew and day of operations tools to airlines in a SaaS model. Our products manage millions of commercial flights every year and that number is growing fast!
You enjoy building products and platforms that are mission critical, getting into the detail, being challenged and the process of building great software. This is an opportunity to actively contribute, lead and leave your mark with a global leader in flight optimisation.
WHAT YOU’LL DO:
Help lead the development effort within the team and influence across teams.
Actively encourage the team to embed software best practices and processes, ultimately providing value to the team, customers and CMS.
Design, develop and deploy technical solutions that meet or exceed business and technical requirements supporting our strategic goals.
Contribute to technical design discussions with architecture, SME’s, and customers.
Maintain clear and regular communication with internal and external stakeholders.
Coach and mentor other engineers through code reviews, lunch time sessions and watercooler conversations.
Provide direction and planning for the development and evolution of the merlot.aero rules framework, optimization tools, optimization UI and API’s.
Work with other engineering team members and product teams to define product engineering goals and objectives.
ABOUT YOU:
Qualifications and Experience
Computer Science or Software Engineering degree.
At least 7 years’ work experience as a developer using C#
Commercial experience with JavaScript (React, Angular or similar) web and mobile frameworks.
Experience leading scrum sized delivery team.
Experience leading technical design within and across teams.
Experience working in an agile delivery environment.
3 year’s experience deploying to Microsoft Azure or similar cloud platforms.
Skills
Excellent C#
Webservices (Web API) and Microservices
Strong knowledge of .NET Framework and design patterns.
Strong SQL Server.
Must love TDD, automation, and taking responsibility for code quality.
A strong desire to innovate, experiment and make positive change.
High level of problem-solving capability and pragmatism.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
BONUS POINTS:
Airline Experience including working with regulations and day of operations
Exposure to building and deploying software using CI/CD pipelines
Experience or Interest in Machine learning and Data Science
Python Experience
JOINING OUR TEAM
Innovative New Zealand software story headquartered from fantastic central Ponsonby location
Great culture with strong values
#LI-KM1
Position Type

100% kiwi owned company
Eco Positive company looking for like-minded people
Fully remote around NZ

Our client launched a tech-based power company to disrupt Aotearoa’s outdated, self-serving industry. They were the first energy retailer to offer Kiwis a way to purchase cheaper power directly off the wholesale electricity market.

They have stayed true to these foundations of fairness, honesty and transparency as they have grown.

The purpose of this role is to design digital customer experiences and ensure ongoing design and development excellence for their clients.

Specific Responsibilities

Development
Focus on delivering, with support, a brilliant digital customer experience
Prototype rapidly and appropriately to communicate concepts and potential solutions
Collaborate across teams within the company to determine the right opportunities for development
Ensure design outputs meet agreed product and business criteria in order to create solutions that deliver value, and ROI.
Ensure the best possible usability, quality, responsiveness, and performance of the applications
Coordinate with the rest of the business, working across different layers of the infrastructure and collaborate to ensure consistency, and that work is compatible and does not duplicate other work.
Identify user experience deficiencies and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems.
Escalate any technical issues as necessary to the appropriate team members: e.g. the design lead.
Continuous Improvement
Work creatively and collaboratively with wider team to assist the company to come up with new solutions for the needs of the business
Assist other members of the business with continuous improvement in the design process, design thinking, and user-centred practices.
Involvement in recruitment and hiring/involvement in professional development processes within the tech team
Organising events that contribute to our team culture (e.g. hack days, tech talks)
Skills & Experiences
Experience in a B2C product design role
Knowledge of web and mobile UX best practice
Understanding of accessibility needs
Research
Identify market and customer needs - User testing and interviews
Ideation and iteration
Flow mapping
Wireframing
Up-to-date knowledge of design software
Sketch (or equivalent)
Adobe suite (desirable)
Prototyping knowledge
Lo-fidelity paper prototypes
Digital tools (InVision or similar, ability to code a front-end prototype desirable)
Ability to work alongside developers throughout the process
Integrity and high professional standards 100% kiwi owned company

Strong focus on delivering a positive user experience
Develop high-quality, leading edge web applications
Permanent role in a local team with an international client base

Strong focus on delivering a positive user experience
Develop high-quality, leading edge web applications
Permanent role in a local team with an international client base
Join a growing and busy company providing intelligent solutions to overseas clients.

A great role for an Intermediate level Web Developer looking to grow your skills and career in a supportive environment.

What our client can offer:
This New Zealand company values its people and provides a great work environment. The development team is a hardworking and dedicated group of software professionals who all contribute to the ongoing success of the company and their intelligent solutions. If you are passionate about web development and growing your career in this space then this is a role to consider.

What you will do:

Focusing on a great user experience, you will be responsible for developing high-quality, leading edge web applications. Collaborating with the wider team you will plan, design, develop, test and maintain software that is testable, reusable and scalable.
Day to day duties will include:
Developing innovative web applications within the framework that meets UX standards
Writing reusable, effective, and scalable TypeScript code.
Building modular, and reusable components and libraries
Designing, developing, and unit testing software in accordance with established standards.
Participating in peer-reviews of solution designs and related code.
Identifying and encouraging areas for growth and improvement within the Development Team.
Supporting system updates and improvements to key systems as required
Skills and experience we are looking for:

This New Zealand company values its people and provides a great work environment. Account Manager-This is a permanent position and a good rate is on Offer.
We have an opportunity, for the right person, to combine their experience with a passion for creating outstanding experiences for our web and digital marketing clients. You’ll have the opportunity to grow your Account Manager career in a fast-paced web-centric environment, as well as build on your skills in client services.

We’re looking for someone who loves being “the ultimate organiser” to manage client portfolios and grow long lasting relationships.

This position will be ideal for a person who loves all aspects of the web design/development process as well as digital marketing, but most importantly loves working with people (teammates and clients) to get the best possible results.

The role will ultimately suit someone who takes pride in being super efficient, and super organised.

Supported by a well-established agency and a talented team, you’ll be exposed to a huge variety of clients from different industries. Our Auckland office consists of a vibrant and rapidly growing group of over 20 talented in-house designers, creatives, digital marketers and developers.

About the Role:

Keep in contact with the clients, effectively translating their needs into action, and delivering information back to them clearly and efficiently.
Easily juggle a number of clients, ensuring everyone is attended to and kept up to date.
Work with the Marketing, Creative and Development teams to deliver a diverse range of digital campaigns and projects on time and on budget.
Work with energetic and driven sales people to maximize the value we offer to our clients and continue our tradition of delivering excellent results.
Customer relationship building is key – and being able to provide strategic advice to client’s while understanding their business needs.
You will have a sense of urgency and be equipped to work in a fast-paced industry. This position is not for the faint-hearted.
You will be accountable for a portfolio of clients. Your key focus would be around retention and growth.

About Us:

A fabulous team that loves to support one another – It’s a great little office community!
Lots of experience working with a broad range of clients. Learn every day about their businesses and their online needs, and make tonnes of great connections as a primary point of contact.

About You:

5+ years experience in an Account Management role.
Bachelors degree or similar
Previous experience in a digital agency.
While this is not a highly technical role, previous experience and a high level understanding of websites and digital marketing is required.
Enjoys working with clients and has a track record of experience delivering superior customer service.
Ability to build solid relationships with clients.
Instils confidence in clients through competence, professionalism, and a high level of customer service.
Excellent communication and command of the English language. Account Manager-This is a permanent position and a good rate is on Offer.

Our client is a leading provider of cloud storage with well over 200M registered users and is looking for a talented confident UX and technical writer to join their team of designers and developers!

Auckland-based hybrid role with a WFH policy.

This is an exciting, varied role including writing web copy, app and microcopy (dialog boxes/ error messages/ help centre) blogs, job ads, style guides, FAQ’s, tone of voice and more. You will be working closely with a team of UX designers and developers.

To be successful in this role you’ll need to demonstrate confidence in:

Copywriting
Technical writing (experience in user guides or similar helpful)
Microcopy
Understand user flow and context around copy
Working closely with designers and developers
Working with web based and mobile apps
Multi-tasking
Stakeholder management
Once onboard you’ll experience these great benefits:

Fun, diverse and social environment and great supportive team culture
In-house professional development
Competitive salary
Free health insurance
Phone allowance
Lots of variety and chance to grow
If this sounds like a bit of you, and you are in NZ and have the right to work here – please apply online with your CV and portfolio!

Please note that at this stage they are not considering overseas candidates, and only shortlisted candidates will be considered.

Salt is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

NV Interactive is an award winning digital agency with full studios in Christchurch & Wellington. We work with an enviable range of both national and international clients, delivering exceptionally crafted digital experiences.

We take a lot of pride in our work, and we're looking for a talented and experienced front end developer who feels the same way to join our Christchurch studio. If you are experienced, professional, positive, motivated and enjoy working in a fast paced, dynamic environment then this role is for you.

We’re looking for someone…

with a genuine passion for the internet and the creative opportunities it offers
who gets a kick out of crafting beautiful, polished interfaces
who has an excellent knowledge of and experience with modern web standards
who has proven experience using modern tools and frameworks such as Angular, Vue.js
who deeply understands the principles of the responsive web and has demonstrable experience in delivering content across multiple devices
who is familiar with modern CMS platforms - bonus points if you are familiar with the Umbraco platform
who ideally is familiar with Asp.net and C#
with experience in the vagaries of constructing effective HTML email templates for all modern mail clients
who thrives in a fast-paced dynamic environment across multiple projects
who has an eye for typography and who takes pride in the small details
who is an excellent communicator
who plays well with others
We can offer you...

a varied and interesting flow of work
a high profile studio located on the edge of the central city
a great work environment that requires a good sense of humour
To apply, please supply an online portfolio of your work, an up-to-date CV and a short submission as to why we should consider you for this role.

Applicants for this position should have New Zealand residency or a valid work permit and must be available in New Zealand for interviews.

For more information or to apply for this role, please email careers@nvinteractive.com. NV Interactive is an award winning digital agency with full studios in Christchurch & Wellington. The opportunity
Qamcom NZ develops innovative products that combine computing, data, and communications.
We're looking for a full stack web technology expert whose broad background and experience equates to creative design solutions that are both elegant and robust. This is where you come in. Interested?
A bit about us
We're a small, friendly company of designers, developers, and engineers.
We're passionate about technology. Our ambition is to turn technology into value for society, industry, and people.
A bit about you
First and foremost; you are an expert full stack developer: from architecture development through to production delivery.
We work with a diverse variety of technologies and platforms. You will be an expert in at least one area, but will relish the challenge to go outside your comfort zone, if required.
Some technologies you will be familiar with include: JavaScript, modern front-end frameworks (e.g. Angular, Vue, React, Bootstrap), NodeJS, SQL, MongoDB, Python, containerisation, and the usual CI/CD pipelines.
You have a solid amount of industry experience, whether you've come from a formal qualification or made your own path.
And you are probably interested in more than just vanilla web software. Maybe you've written high performance apps in Rust; compiled to WebAssembly. And if you have experience analysing and working with large datasets that would be super-interesting to us.
We work in partnership with companies to develop products and so you will know about communication with clients and stakeholders both here in NZ and overseas.
Finally, you have the right to live and work in Wellington, New Zealand. Ideally you're already here!
Some benefits (in addition to a competitive salary)
Our office is in the Wellington CBD with nice views over the city to the harbour.
Do you like skiing? We like doing that too.
We're super-flexible on hours and ways of working. We've been working like this for a long time: well before COVID came along.
And we enjoy working with, and using, the latest tools and technologies.
Still interested?

We're passionate about technology. Our ambition is to turn technology into value for society, industry, and people.
A bit about you
First and foremost; you are an expert full stack developer: from architecture development through to production delivery.
We work with a diverse variety of technologies and platforms. You will be an expert in at least one area, but will relish the challenge to go outside your comfort zone, if required.
Some technologies you will be familiar with include: JavaScript, modern front-end frameworks (e.g. Angular, Vue, React, Bootstrap), NodeJS, SQL, MongoDB, Python, containerisation, and the usual CI/CD pipelines.
You have a solid amount of industry experience, whether you've come from a formal qualification or made your own path.
And you are probably interested in more than just vanilla web software. Maybe you've written high performance apps in Rust; compiled to WebAssembly. And if you have experience analysing and working with large datasets that would be super-interesting to us.
We work in partnership with companies to develop products and so you will know about communication with clients and stakeholders both here in NZ and overseas.
Finally, you have the right to live and work in Wellington, New Zealand. Ideally you're already here!
Some benefits (in addition to a competitive salary)
Our office is in the Wellington CBD with nice views over the city to the harbour.
Do you like skiing? We like doing that too.
We're super-flexible on hours and ways of working. We've been working like this for a long time: well before COVID came along.
And we enjoy working with, and using, the latest tools and technologies.
Still interested?
Excellent! We have lots to talk about... The opportunity
Qamcom NZ develops innovative products that combine computing, data, and communications.
We're looking for a full stack web technology expert whose broad background and experience equates to creative design solutions that are both elegant and robust. This is where you come in. Interested?

12 Aug 2022
Help Save Lives with this exciting start-up!
Work from Office based in Devonport
Be creative, drive success and make your mark

ABOUT THE COMPANY

Our Client is an exciting medical device start-up, whose mission is to help save lives. The company has developed a revolutionary solution to improve medication safety. This will not only save lives, but also reduce healthcare costs. They have multiple international patents pending and are set to take off in the next 12 months.

They are growing the current technical team of 6 over the next few months. They are looking for candidates who are motivated to make a change in the world, who are passionate about working in a startup environment with a one-of-a-kind product. This is not a sit at the back / hide in the weeds job!

ABOUT THE ROLE

On a day-to day basis you might be:

Architecting, designing and implementing scalable, distributed and highly secure web portal solutions for Client, Administration/Support, Billing and Orchestration use
Enhancing the DevOps capabilities for continuous development, automated testing and release
Developing enhanced APIs, and working to integrate with third party providers and client solutions
Getting to collaborate with a fantastic team of passionate people
Working in an Agile development environment

REQUIREMENTS

Own and drive the cloud-delivered Software solutions.
Be highly experienced developing web applications using your knowledge of architectures, frameworks, languages, databases and hosting platforms
Have direct experience designing and implementing REST, SOAP or DDP web services
Have direct experience with developing web apps using technologies such as React, HTML, CSS, JavaScript and Django
Be experienced with SQL databases and modelling (MySQL, PostgreSQL)
Be very competent using GitHub, GitFlow, Jira, Confluence, etc.
Be very competent developing using AWS tools and platform services
Be fully competent with DevOps technical requirements and implementing these to provide a highly available, high-performance cloud-delivered release & production environment

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

Be a team player who is confident to speak up with ideas and issues
Have a degree or qualification in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Electronic Engineering, or similar
Have 4+ years professional experience
Have exceptional problem-solving skill

BENEFITS

You will be part of a small team of innovators, creators, and doers that are working on something truly lifesaving.
This is your chance to be creative, drive success and make your mark……rather than be a cog in a large machine.
They offer a creative team working environment in our office in Devonport, Auckland, with stunning views out across the inner harbour to the CBD.
Work from the Office but flexible schedules to deal with life admin.


Click the APPLY button and include your resume and cover letter or for further information please call Julian on 09 3025314 or 027 279 5359

Location: Wellington /Auckland

About Capgemini

Capgemini is a diverse collective of more than 330,000 strategic and technological experts based across more than 50 countries, partnering with world-renowned clients to transform and manage their businesses. We are dedicated to leveraging cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering, and platforms to address the entire breadth of their business needs. This passion drives a powerful commitment - to unlock the true value of technology.
Over the last 18 months, we have tripled our business in Australia and New Zealand, with over 3,300 team members devoted to helping clients get the future they want. Now is the time to join our rapidly growing team who are at the forefront of finding new ways technology can help us reimagine what's possible, collecting unique career experiences with global brands and game-changing tech projects.

Let's talk about the team:
Our Digital Customer Experience (DCX) team partner with businesses to help them adapt and respond effectively to the challenges of a constantly changing world, this is done by delivering thought leading transformational solutions. We're also a Salesforce global strategic partner, one of the largest Salesforce partners in Australia, a leader in the Gartner magic quadrant for CRM and have received numerous Salesforce Innovation Awards.

Within our Salesforce team we are continually driving customer value, by leveraging the power of the World's #1 Digital Platform. Our focus areas are Multi Cloud, Digital Agility and Enterprise Integration and Deployment.

Let's talk about the role and responsibilities:
In this role, you have the unique opportunity to be a foundational member of a new start-up business, building the Perth Salesforce practice from the ground up. With sponsorship from our executive leadership, this opportunity will provide the freedom to explore new innovative solutions to meet a variety of unique business challenges -with the depth and breadth of experience from Capgemini, a global Salesforce leader. Your day-to-day activities will involve in a wide range of activities - from pre-sales through delivery - with access to experts to support and guide you along the way. As a self-starter, your curiosity and passion for the right solution will drive you - and your high-quality development and attention to detail will be your key contribution to the delivery success of the team.

Salesforce Developer - (Lead Consultant)
As a Salesforce Developer, you'll work alongside a team of like-minded individuals within the Salesforce community and partner closely with our clients on a wide variety of collaborative and innovative engagements. You'll be:


Utilising your core consulting and Salesforce skills to offer technical knowledge and implementation experience with all core Salesforce tools, offerings, and products.
Active participation in development workstreams within projects.
Developing solutions to address any company-wide issues and making their processes more efficient.
Designing process and creating complex workflows and triggers.
Involved in APEX development, Lightning components and complex Salesforce configuration.
Working within the development team in analysing, designing, coding and unit testing Salesforce solutions.
Using your experience to guide our clients in best practices and better ways of achieving their goals.
Working alongside a team of talented technical Salesforce people, knowledge sharing and supporting each other to help each other develop your expertise in Salesforce.

Let's talk about your capability and experience:What we're looking for in Developers would be your:

Be able to proactively work in a fast-paced environment, as a team
Knowledge and experience in Salesforce platform, particularly across Sales Cloud, Service Cloud and Community Cloud and common AppExchange apps
Demonstrated understanding of underlying client business problems and the ability to develop Salesforce technology-enabled solutions that addresses their needs.
Extensive knowledge of all aspects of Salesforce declarative programming techniques.
Proven experience of Apex, Triggers, Classes and Lightning Web Components, and API Web Services
Ability to problem solve, coupled with a tenacious nature spurred on further by something not working as it should.
Capability to communicate with stakeholders, whilst also managing their expectations.
DevOps (Salesforce DX) experience preferred, including use of DevOps tools such as git.
Certification(s) in Platform Developer II; Sales; Service; or Community Cloud.

Let's talk about what's in it for you!

We believe technology is about more than business transformation - it's also about building a more sustainable, inclusive future. This starts with our people, working with you to get the future you want. We invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work, contributing to our inclusive culture and a safe place for our people to be themselves and truly belong. Through championing our staff-led community groups, we are committed to being active allies for everyone. We also aim to build an environment where you can thrive at work and at home. We champion remote working - even though you'll want to check out our beautiful offices - and are in the process of making ‘truly flexible' working arrangements the day-to-day reality for our people. In addition, we strive to ensure your growth and learning experience is unique with access to leading learning platforms, external certifications and opportunities to grow and learn the way you want. Finally, we offer opportunities to use your skills to help society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution, and we're ruthlessly focused on sustainability for our clients and our business - committing to becoming a net zero business by 2030.
We work to recruit and retain a talented and diverse workforce. We strongly encourage applications from suitably qualified candidates regardless of their gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, ability, intersex status or age.
Capgemini Australia has developed and manages, process orientated Management Systems compliant to the requirements of ISO9001, ISO27001 and ISO14001. We are committed to delivering secure solutions and services through state-of-the-art processes and continual improvement frameworks in line with industry best practices as well as contractual, statutory and regulatory requirements.
#GetTheFutureYouWant - Come join us, bring your whole self to work, create new possibilities for you, your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures.

Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered.

Through championing our staff-led community groups, we are committed to being active allies for everyone. We also aim to build an environment where you can thrive at work and at home. We champion remote working - even though you'll want to check out our beautiful offices - and are in the process of making ‘truly flexible' working arrangements the day-to-day reality for our people. In addition, we strive to ensure your growth and learning experience is unique with access to leading learning platforms, external certifications and opportunities to grow and learn the way you want. Finally, we offer opportunities to use your skills to help society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution, and we're ruthlessly focused on sustainability for our clients and our business - committing to becoming a net zero business by 2030.
We work to recruit and retain a talented and diverse workforce. We strongly encourage applications from suitably qualified candidates regardless of their gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, ability, intersex status or age.
Capgemini Australia has developed and manages, process orientated Management Systems compliant to the requirements of ISO9001, ISO27001 and ISO14001. We are committed to delivering secure solutions and services through state-of-the-art processes and continual improvement frameworks in line with industry best practices as well as contractual, statutory and regulatory requirements.
#GetTheFutureYouWant - Come join us, bring your whole self to work, create new possibilities for you, your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures.

Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered.

Senior Software Developer, Digital Delivery
Lead the software delivery of cutting-edge digital products and services, with a focus on cloud-based applications
Innovate across a diverse range of software and technology integration projects through your delivery and mentoring, working alongside a motivated team of software developers
Career development opportunities, with the potential to move into technical leadership, project delivery, or people leadership
Te Kāinga Rua | The Opportunity

Play a key role in the delivery of our innovative software and technology products and services. You will be working collaboratively with our internal teams to deliver a range of software solutions to our diverse customer base. This role will enable you to leverage your software development and project delivery skills in a real-world setting, as a key contributor to the delivery of new and existing Beca digital projects, both in New Zealand and globally. You will be comfortable sharing your knowledge and expertise and helping the team to grow their technical capability. You will be considered a go-to person who is trusted to effectively deliver complex solutions. With a broad range of software solutions in play, the ability to switch focus and prioritise work is a must.

At Beca Digital, we believe in innovation and encourage diversity of thought. We invite applicants from a range of backgrounds with the following experience, skills, and attributes:
Experience as a full stack developer with cloud-based software products, web development, systems integration using APIs, distributed systems, software security and storage systems
Experience using cloud computing services, specifically MS Azure, to provide software solutions with high availability requirements
Experience collaborating with software developers leveraging your experience to drive innovative behaviours
Support the technical direction for software solutions throughout the software lifecycle including planning, estimation, feature development, ongoing support, and growing and guiding the product and technical road-map
Proactive, flexible, and comfortable with ambiguity
Great communication skills with the ability to build meaningful and collaborative relationships across various levels of a business
C#, TypeScript, JavaScript, SQL, .NET core, React
In addition, knowledge and experience across the following is not critical, however would be beneficial:
Agile development background using Scrum or other Agile methodologies
Docker, Kubernetes, Microsoft Power Apps, Power Automate, Flow, Dataverse
Experience with other programming languages, such as Python, Go, F#, etc
Experience with Microservices
Te rongoā | About You

You enjoy working across different projects with a range of clients, developing and delivering solutions and new digital offerings. You enjoy working with a motivated team of Software Developers and multi-disciplinary Engineers that combine technical ‘know how’ with enabling software and technologies. You are driven to continuously grow and improve your technical skill set as well as your soft skill set. You will also enjoy playing a leadership role enabling the growth of the culture in this team.

Beca Digital

Beca Digital is moving into a significant stage of growth, working with our clients to solve real world and unique problems. Our clients work with us to develop creative solutions that leverage cloud based and on-prem products and services. We are developing a platform based approach to delivering exciting and cost effective software solutions that overcome some of the challenges of purely bespoke software. This combination of software building blocks and bespoke software make our digital roles challenging and unique. Career development opportunities exist as our business develops, with potential to move into Solution Architecture, Product Ownership, Digital Consulting, people leadership or into digital project delivery.

Our Digital Products and Services Team includes over 50 digital consultants, GIS specialists, data analysts and software developers. As a team, we play a central role in leading digital transformation across Beca, embracing change through an ongoing process of continuous improvement and adoption of agile practices.

You will be working across our key digital offerings, including our cutting edge digital twin platform (FACILITYtwin) for operational management and industrial asset information models, and a portfolio management software product (CAPEXinsight) that is used globally by one of the world’s largest FMCG companies.

Learn more about Digital at Beca here: https://www.beca.com/digital-transformation and https://youtu.be/n9J4sZ_SMvg

Apply now

To apply for this role, please follow the online instructions. With the New Zealand Christmas holiday period fast approaching, applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis. To give our people and leadership teams a well-deserved break after this year, our offices will be closed from the 23rd of December until the 10th of January 2022. We will endeavour to ensure all applicants are updated by late January 2022.

Beca will require successful candidates to provide proof that they are fully vaccinated against Covid-19 subject to the terms of Beca’s Vaccination Policy. Further details will be provided during the application process.

Role type: Permanent
Location: Auckland
Job published on: 02 August 2022
Our client is a global organisation that works on government-based projects across NZ, Australia, and USA. The client is in need of developers who have expertise in Java development.

To qualify, you must:
The current technology stack is mainly composed of Java 8/11, ES9, VueJs/ReactJs, Spring Boot, Micro-services, MongoDB, Docker, RabbitMQ, Elastic, Azure, AWS ecosystem, Kotlin, Groovy
A sound technical knowledge of programming, system design, IT infrastructure and database concepts with applicable platforms, frameworks, servers, language, tools and technology.
At least 2 years’ experience of one or more programming languages (e.g. Java, Groovy, C#, PHP, etc.).
A thorough understanding and relevant experience in web technologies (e.g. XML, HTML, Javascript, JSON, CSS).
Good understanding and implementation experience of web services (Rest or SOAP)
Thorough understanding of all aspects of the software development lifecycle (SDLC); experience in Scrum teams preferred
Experience using SDLC tools such as defect tracking systems (e.g. Jira), source control systems (e.g. Stash), build and continuous delivery (e.g. Jenkins).
Good understanding of database concepts and working knowledge of SQL / MongoDB.

Innovate with purpose

Do you want to work for a company that is innovating and making a difference to the health and wellbeing of people all over the world? We're not about selling meaningless, unnecessary products for corporate profitability. You'll be working on technology that will revolutionise global health systems so that we can finally get the healthcare we all want - a basic human right.

We like to think of ourselves as a community of start ups where you can be your true, genuine self. Each of our product teams have the autonomy to decide how they operate and contribute towards our mission of providing each person with the right care at the right time and in the right place.

Orion Health is excited to be expanding our galaxy by recruiting for a number of stellar individuals to join our team to help us deliver to our global customer base. If you want to climb aboard the rocketship and help us revolutionise global health systems, astronomical opportunities await.


What will you be doing?

We're on the hunt for an Intermediate Software Engineer within our Amadeus - Clinical Portal team. You will join a cross-functional, agile development team who are working on a secure web-based solution that provides a unified interface to access and view a longitudinal patient health record, with data combined from integrated source systems.

As an Intermediate Software Engineer, you will:

be engaged with all aspects of development right from design, to delivery and support,
be fully involved with helping to steer best practices and approaches adopted by the team,
have the ability to think creatively and be confident in making suggestions,
develop solid and well-structured software will play a key role in the successful delivery of the solution, and
get the opportunity to directly influence the experience clinicians and health practitioners have when using the product, impacting real world delivery of care to patients across the globe.


What will you bring to the role?

Solid understanding of software architecture and software design with demonstrated ability to analyse, design, troubleshoot, and modify complex software products.
Proficiency in JAVA is an advantage.
Front end web development experience with technologies such as React, HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
Experience with databases such as Oracle and Microsoft SQL Server is an asset.
Experience working with cloud based technology (eg. AWS).
Experience with CloudFormation or Terraform, Docker, Ansible, automation, ECS, Lambda are a plus.
Automated testing framework experience such as JUnit, Jest, Selenium, Cypress is a bonus.
Inquisitive, detailed oriented and with a problem-solving mindset.
Experience working in an Agile working environment and be a great team player and communicator.
Be able to mentor and grow junior developers.


What's in it for you?

Health Insurance (eligibility applies).
Ability to top up your standard annual leave balance with LeavePlus.
Work for up to 30 days per year in another country through our TravelFlex initiative.
You'll use the latest languages and platforms and will be joining the ranks of the most talented and experienced tech workers in the industry.
Our relaxed, open plan offices have a vibrant and energetic atmosphere. We also have a casual dress-code so you will feel as comfortable in the office as you would at home.
Flexibility is important. We encourage our people to design a workday that suits them by offering flexible working arrangements.
Love food and coffee? We provide free breakfast and fruit every day and have a barista coffee machine in the office - not to mention the onsite cafe discount!
With weekly Friday drinks and an active social club, Orionites are never short of good times and we pride ourselves on our fun community.
We support our Orionites keenness to learn and grow by providing unlimited access to LinkedIn Learning.


If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you! Innovate with purpose

You'll use the latest languages and platforms and will be joining the ranks of the most talented and experienced tech workers in the industry.
Our relaxed, open plan offices have a vibrant and energetic atmosphere. We also have a casual dress-code so you will feel as comfortable in the office as you would at home.
Flexibility is important. We encourage our people to design a workday that suits them by offering flexible working arrangements.
Love food and coffee? We provide free breakfast and fruit every day and have a barista coffee machine in the office - not to mention the onsite cafe discount!
With weekly Friday drinks and an active social club, Orionites are never short of good times and we pride ourselves on our fun community.
We support our Orionites keenness to learn and grow by providing unlimited access to LinkedIn Learning.


If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you! Innovate with purpose

Do you want to work for a company that is innovating and making a difference to the health and wellbeing of people all over the world? We're not about selling meaningless, unnecessary products for corporate profitability. You'll be working on technology that will revolutionise global health systems so that we can finally get the healthcare we all want - a basic human right.

We like to think of ourselves as a community of start ups where you can be your true, genuine self. Each of our product teams have the autonomy to decide how they operate and contribute towards our mission of providing each person with the right care at the right time and in the right place.

Orion Health is excited to be expanding our galaxy by recruiting for a number of stellar individuals to join our team to help us deliver to our global customer base. If you want to climb aboard the rocketship and help us revolutionise global health systems, astronomical opportunities await.


What will you be doing?

We're on the hunt for an Intermediate Software Engineer within our Amadeus - Clinical Portal team. You will join a cross-functional, agile development team who are working on a secure web-based solution that provides a unified interface to access and view a longitudinal patient health record, with data combined from integrated source systems.

As an Intermediate Software Engineer, you will:

be engaged with all aspects of development right from design, to delivery and support,
be fully involved with helping to steer best practices and approaches adopted by the team,
have the ability to think creatively and be confident in making suggestions,
develop solid and well-structured software will play a key role in the successful delivery of the solution, and
get the opportunity to directly influence the experience clinicians and health practitioners have when using the product, impacting real world delivery of care to patients across the globe.


What will you bring to the role?

Solid understanding of software architecture and software design with demonstrated ability to analyse, design, troubleshoot, and modify complex software products.
Proficiency in JAVA is an advantage.
Front end web development experience with technologies such as React, HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
Experience with databases such as Oracle and Microsoft SQL Server is an asset.
Experience working with cloud based technology (eg. AWS).
Experience with CloudFormation or Terraform, Docker, Ansible, automation, ECS, Lambda are a plus.
Automated testing framework experience such as JUnit, Jest, Selenium, Cypress is a bonus.
Inquisitive, detailed oriented and with a problem-solving mindset.
Experience working in an Agile working environment and be a great team player and communicator.
Be able to mentor and grow junior developers.


What's in it for you?

Health Insurance (eligibility applies).
Ability to top up your standard annual leave balance with LeavePlus.
Work for up to 30 days per year in another country through our TravelFlex initiative.
You'll use the latest languages and platforms and will be joining the ranks of the most talented and experienced tech workers in the industry.
Our relaxed, open plan offices have a vibrant and energetic atmosphere. We also have a casual dress-code so you will feel as comfortable in the office as you would at home.
Flexibility is important. We encourage our people to design a workday that suits them by offering flexible working arrangements.
Love food and coffee? We provide free breakfast and fruit every day and have a barista coffee machine in the office - not to mention the onsite cafe discount!
With weekly Friday drinks and an active social club, Orionites are never short of good times and we pride ourselves on our fun community.
We support our Orionites keenness to learn and grow by providing unlimited access to LinkedIn Learning.


If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you! Show more

Why choose us?

Culture
The culture at Annalect is simply one of a kind. We have a culture that we're very proud of over here in Mt Eden, with plenty of initiatives and events throughout the year which constantly creates a buzz around the office as well as strong bonds between employees.

Flexible Working
Flexible working is built on trust and open communication which we highly encourage here at Annalect. You also have access to Birthday Leave, Summer/Winter Fridays, Gifted Day.

Health & Wellbeing
An annual $200 healthy lifestyle allowance, access to our ongoing ‘Thrive' personal wellbeing program, the opportunity to join a range of Annalect/OMD's sports teams, and even free brekkie & coffee!

Learning & Development
We want to encourage our staff to utilise as many opportunities as possible to learn and grow. We offer all types of training, here we pretty much tailor your training to suit your level of the role including our talked-about mentoring program.

So, if you feel you're up for the challenge, this is the opportunity for you! Please apply with a cover letter and resume via the job ad ASAP!

Annalect/OMD is a proud member of Diversity Works NZ and an equal opportunity employer. We offer great flexibility for employees and have a strong focus on health and wellbeing. Here's a sneak peek into the agency for you to enjoy: https://diversityworksnz.org.nz/case-studies/2020-diversity-awards-nz/emerging-diversity-inclusion-omd-new-zealand

Position Purpose

This customer facing role is responsible for customer success through delivery management of cross-functional analytics and data projects. Acting as a conduit between technical and non-technical client teams, the key purpose of this role is to identify and deliver analytical direction and projects with robust actionable insights to inform strategy and on-going optimisation of media effectiveness for clients.

You will manage a team of Data Scientists, Business Intelligence and Developer resource. While establishing the quality of output ensuring the Annalect data team set the standard as being the industry leaders that others aspire to be like.

The agency world is being shaken up like never before. We can no longer just rely on client relationships, creative ideas, and media owner relationships to secure future success. Now our clients want depth and specialisms in new areas, powered by the significant advancement in data sophistication we now have at our fingertips.

OMD acknowledged this changing dynamic in 2012 and launched "Annalect Solutions" as a specialist business unit focusing on Marketing Mix, Digital Attribution and DRTV optimisation.

We are now moving beyond our Attribution & ROI modelling roots. Annalect is in a strong position to make sense of the exciting yet daunting world of data and technology.

Skills and Experience:

3-4 years experience in media is essential with an understanding of media measurement frameworks is preferred.
Sound understanding of Web Analytics (GA4, GA360) and Martech or proficiency in Data Science and reporting automation in advertising.
Experience preferred in at least one of the following external client management or line management.
Great interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with highly analytical people; whilst being able to convey technical concepts to less technical individuals.
Passion for best practices in data and media disciplines.
Ability to work to be a self-starter and have a constantly curious mind.
Proven ability to meet established deadlines.
Talent for quickly learning new platforms.
Good multi-tasking and organisational skills, plans work in advance, deciding on the most efficient or convenient way to do assigned tasks or projects.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, understand the factors/forces that shape customer (internal and external) needs (including private and institutional customers), easily comprehends the customer's position, and find innovative and cost-effective solutions to problems.
Demonstrate ability to work autonomously, self-motivated, and capable of working independently with minimal management, good time management and planning skills.
Communication skills (verbal) - orally communicates ideas, instructions, and information so that they are clearly understood by others in formal or informal situations.
Communications skills (written) - writes clear, concise, and grammatically correct presentations, that others can easily understand.
Passion for data, being a champion of data within the agency and being able to influence key internal audiences to understand how technology can be used to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the agency and its clients.
Outstanding attention to detail to ensure the expectations we set with internal and external stakeholders are realistic, achievable, and ultimately delivered upon.

 Why choose us?

Culture
The culture at Annalect is simply one of a kind. We have a culture that we're very proud of over here in Mt Eden, with plenty of initiatives and events throughout the year which constantly creates a buzz around the office as well as strong bonds between employees.

Flexible Working
Flexible working is built on trust and open communication which we highly encourage here at Annalect. You also have access to Birthday Leave, Summer/Winter Fridays, Gifted Day.

Health & Wellbeing
An annual $200 healthy lifestyle allowance, access to our ongoing ‘Thrive' personal wellbeing program, the opportunity to join a range of Annalect/OMD's sports teams, and even free brekkie & coffee!

Learning & Development
We want to encourage our staff to utilise as many opportunities as possible to learn and grow. We offer all types of training, here we pretty much tailor your training to suit your level of the role including our talked-about mentoring program.

So, if you feel you're up for the challenge, this is the opportunity for you! Please apply with a cover letter and resume via the job ad ASAP!

Annalect/OMD is a proud member of Diversity Works NZ and an equal opportunity employer. We offer great flexibility for employees and have a strong focus on health and wellbeing. Here's a sneak peek into the agency for you to enjoy: https://diversityworksnz.org.nz/case-studies/2020-diversity-awards-nz/emerging-diversity-inclusion-omd-new-zealand

 Show more

About us
Pegasus Health supports many aspects of health and wellbeing in Canterbury. We provide services and support to general practices and community-based health providers to deliver quality health care to patients.
We work in partnership with our communities, general practices and other health providers to improve the health and wellbeing of people in our communities, all while aiming to make Canterbury the best place to receive and provide care.
Working with our communities, means being committed to the principles of Te Tiriti o Waitangi and working in a bicultural manner to improve equitable access and outcomes for Māori. We're committed to improving equitable access and outcomes for Pacific, CALD, LGBTQI+ and other priority populations.
What you will be doing
Reporting to the Product Manager - HealthOne, we are looking for an experienced Senior Tester to help us ensure the ongoing high quality of HealthOne, New Zealand’s South Island shared Health Record. Your focus will be software testing and the wider quality issues associated with software product release including leading and mentoring. There will be exposure to a broad range of professional challenges, including test strategy and planning, implementing automated testing, creating and executing test cases and ensuring the successful release of our systems to users. Testers work closely with developers, product owners and business analysts in Scrum teams and we use the latest in automation tools, issue and agile management systems and test case management systems.
What you will bring
This is a senior role. You will take leadership in new technologies and testing best practice. Applicants should have at least 5-7 years commercial testing experience and should demonstrate experience, expertise and leadership in most of the skills and attributes listed below:
qualifications and/or experience in a relevant commercial environment
passion for excellence in QA and testing
experience in creating test strategies and plans
implementation and maintenance of a test automation suite
knowledge of privacy and security issues and best practice
proven ability to analyse complex scenarios
an understanding of web technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, XML, HTTP
UI test scripting and automation (Selenium, Watir, Ranorex)
web services and API testing (REST, Json, XML, HL7)
knowledge of database systems and SQL (SQL server)
management of test environments (VMware)
issue and test case management systems (Jira, Enterprise Tester)
software version control (SVN, Git)
UI and usability design skills
Scrum/Agile experience essential
strong documentation and issue reporting skills
a naturally inquisitive nature and pedantic attention to detail
strong customer and team-oriented focus
commitment to continued personal development in IT
What we offer / What's in it for you
Be part of a people-centred health service
Collaborative and inclusive culture
Range of wellness benefits including a wellness subsidy, free after-hours medical care
Flexible-working options. We are happy to discuss potential flexible options for this position at the interview stage.
As part of keeping everyone healthy and safe, we require all new employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.
Closing date for application is 1 March 2022
For further information about Pegasus Health visit: www.pegasus.org.nz
For further information about the role please contact Troy Gilmore at Troy.Gilmore@pegasus.org.nz. About us
